Das said, "I have been requesting for long to relieve me from the responsibility. I am a person who is an expert in building organisation...I have not resigned from my MLA post and the membership of BJP."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: T'gana CM KCR meets PM Modi; requests setting up of IIM in state
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Friday. He requested a grant-in-aid of ₹1,000 crore for the development of an integrated state-of-the-art textile park in Warangal. He also requested that an Indian Institute of Management (IIM) be established in Telangana and sought a review of IPS cadre in the state.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Govt selling its assets in name of monetisation policy: Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Friday alleged that the Centre was planning to sell off its assets in the name of National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP). "All that has been built over the last 70 years is being pawned off into the hands of a select few," he added. "The government will never allow a discussion on this issue," Chidambaram said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP, MNS must read Centre's letter: Maha Dy CM on opening temples
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that BJP and MNS leaders demanding the reopening of temples in Maharashtra should read central leadership's letter on the reopening of religious places. "We too want to respect residents' faith. No government wishes to close religious places, but we cannot act on emotions and agitations...we should follow caution," he added.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Ex-minister Veerappa Moily to head Congress panel on caste census
text: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Friday set up a committee headed by former Union Minister Veerappa Moily to look into the issue of caste census. This comes after many parties demanded a caste-based census and sub-categorisation of castes in the country. The panel consists of Abhishek Singhvi, Salman Khurshid, Mohan Prakash, RPN Singh, PL Punia and Kuldeep Bishnoi.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Declare Taliban a terrorist group or don't call Muslims 'Talibani': Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday said that BJP leaders should stop calling poor Muslims as "Talibani" if they are unwilling to declare Taliban and Haqqani Network as terrorist organisations under the country's UAPA. Owaisi added, "Every day, this is happening...If anybody politically opposes the BJP, irrespective of religion, they give them the title of Talibani thinking."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Adhir Ranjan writes to Mamata, alleges violence against Congress
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday wrote to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee alleging that Congress workers have become victims of "violence and atrocities committed by the ruling party's workers". He urged the CM to "intervene and ensure justice" to them. He also alleged that the houses of the Congress workers were vandalised and looted in broad daylight.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Digvijaya Singh is Pakistan's sleeper cell: Madhya Pradesh minister
text: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Sarang on Friday said that the Congress leader Digvijaya Singh is "Pakistan's sleeper cell". This comes after the Congress announced that Singh will head the party's panel to "plan sustained agitations on national issues". Sarang added that Singh "making strategies of protest against the government is a matter of severe seriousness".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Anil Deshmukh moves Bombay HC against ED summons in corruption case
text: Former Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh on Thursday moved the Bombay High Court against the summons issued to him by Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case. The ED has issued five summons to Deshmukh so far but he skipped all of them. Last month, he approached the Supreme Court against the summons and sought protection from arrest.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Kashmiri separatist leader Syed Ali Shah Geelani passes away at 91
text: Kashmiri separatist leader Syed Ali Shah Geelani has died at his residence in Srinagar. The senior leader had resigned from the All Parties Hurriyat Conference (G) last year in June, alleging that the amalgam was ailing due to its members' "mismanagement". Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti has condoled his demise.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bengal govt approaches SC against CBI probe into post-poll violence
text: The West Bengal government led by TMC chief Mamata Banerjee has approached the Supreme Court against a Calcutta High Court order which handed over the investigation into post-poll violence to CBI. The government claimed the agency is working at the behest of the Centre and it doesn't expect a fair investigation. CBI had registered 31 cases till Monday.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Biswajit Das becomes 3rd BJP MLA to return to TMC after Assembly polls
text: West Bengal's Bagda BJP MLA Biswajit Das on Tuesday rejoined the Trinamool Congress, becoming the third BJP MLA after Tanmay Ghosh and Mukul Roy to switch sides post the Mamata Banerjee-led party won the Assembly polls. Das had left TMC for BJP in June 2019. "I've returned to my home now. I never felt very comfortable in BJP," Das said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: AAP will contest on all 403 seats in 2022 UP Assembly polls: Sanjay Singh
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest on all 403 seats in Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls next year, party's Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh has said. Singh, who is also the AAP Uttar Pradesh in-charge, said the names of the candidates will be declared in the next 15 days. As of now, the list of 120 candidates is ready, he said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Case against Pune Mayor, Maha BJP chief for violating COVID-19 rules at protest
text: A case was registered against Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil, Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol and others for violating COVID-19 guidelines during a protest in the city on Monday demanding the reopening of religious places in Maharashtra. BJP city President Jagdish Mulik and some other party workers were also booked. The group had asked for permission to protest which was denied.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rising GDP means rise in gas, diesel and petrol prices: Rahul Gandhi
text: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday criticised Centre over rising prices of cooking gas, diesel and petrol. "Modi Ji keeps saying that GDP is rising. I then understood what he means by GDP. It means 'Gas-Diesel-Petrol'," he said. He claimed the Centre earned ₹23 lakh crore through gas, diesel and petrol and asked, "Where did ₹23 lakh crore go?"
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: TN govt dissolves university named after Jayalalithaa, AIADMK protests
text: Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday passed a Bill in the Assembly to integrate a university named after late CM J Jayalalithaa with another state-run institution, the Annamalai University. The opposition AIADMK staged a walkout and blocked a road, protesting against the move and dubbed it "political vendetta". They were later removed by the police and lodged in a hall.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Rawat apologies for 'Panj Pyare' remark, says 'will sweep gurdwara floor'
text: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Wednesday apologised for referring to the party's Punjab leadership as "Panj Pyare". "I used...'Panj Pyare' as a reference for a respected person. Still, if my words hurt the feelings of any person, I apologise and take my words back," he said. "For atonement, I will sweep the floors of a Gurdwara in Uttarakhand," Rawat added.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: It looks very nice: Punjab CM amid criticism over Jallianwala complex revamp
text: Amid criticism over the renovation of the Jallianwala Bagh complex in Amritsar, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "I don't know what has been removed. To me, it (the renovated complex) looks very nice." Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had earlier called the renovation "an insult to martyrs", with the party saying it was an attempt at "re-writing history".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Abhishek Banerjee's wife skips ED summons, cites 'risk to infants'
text: TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee's wife Rujira Banerjee, who was supposed to appear before Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday for questioning in connection with a coal scam, skipped the summons. "I am a mother of two infants, and travelling to New Delhi...alone in...the pandemic will put...my children at...risk," she told ED, adding that she is willing to be questioned in Kolkata.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: MP Cong shares poster depicting Kamal Nath as Lord Krishna, CM as 'Kans Mama'
text: A poster depicting Congress' Kamal Nath as Lord Krishna and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan as 'Kans Mama' was put up outside the Congress office in Bhopal. "Through this poster, people are urging Kamal Nath Ji to contest 2023 polls and teach BJP a lesson...CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has not done enough here," Shahyar Khan, Congress leader, said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: K'taka district scraps 'no COVID-19 vaccine, no ration' initiative
text: The Chamarajanagar district administration in Karnataka has withdrawn COVID-19 vaccination initiative that stated "no vaccination, no ration", "no vaccination, no pension". The initiative was to begin on Wednesday with an aim to fight vaccine hesitancy. However, it was criticised, with Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) President DK Shivakumar saying that the move was "unconstitutional".
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Ex-Tamil Nadu CM Panneerselvam's wife passes away following illness
text: AIADMK coordinator and former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam's wife Vijayalakshmi passed away on Wednesday. During the past two weeks, the 66-year-old had been undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Chennai due to the severity of her health. Vijayalakshmi is survived by her husband, one daughter and two sons.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Rajiv Gandhi's name dropped from Assam's Orang National Park
text: The Assam cabinet on Wednesday decided to drop former PM Rajiv Gandhi's name from the Orang National Park. Minister Pijush Hazarika said the decision was taken as the name Orang is linked with sentiments of Adivasi and the tea-tribe community. The park was renamed after the late PM in 2005 by a Congress-led government despite objections from local groups.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Telangana is being ruled by liquor, land, sand mafias: Sambit Patra
text: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra has said that liquor, land and sand mafias are ruling Telangana and also alleged that TRS-led state government is involved in them. "Only KCR family got employment and the entire state got unemployed...The KCR-led government is making people slaves to alcoholism," he stated. Patra was speaking at Praja Sangrama Yatra that began on August 28.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Govt to install Karunanidhi statue in Chennai's Anna Salai: Stalin
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday announced in the Assembly that the state government would install a statue of former Chief Minister and DMK leader M Karunanidhi at Anna Salai in Chennai. Anna Salai earlier had a statue of Karunanidhi but it was damaged during the violence after AIADMK founder MG Ramachandran's death in December 1987.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Will Taliban be recognised: Owaisi after India-Taliban talks in Doha
text: Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday reacted to the first formal talks between India and Taliban in Doha and asked if the group will be "recognised" by India. "India chairs UN Taliban sanctions committee, will this mean that they'll be delisted?" he tweeted. He also asked if Taliban gave assurances to India about removing Pakistan-based terrorists.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: TN BJP to hold protests against Assembly motion opposing farm laws
text: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai said that protests would be held in September against the resolution passed in the state Assembly by the DMK government seeking to repeal Centre's three farm laws. Annamalai had earlier said, "Without discussing this in the Assembly, passing a resolution to repeal the laws is an eyewash." The resolution was passed on August 28.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Such talks have no basis: Nitish Kumar on being called 'PM material'
text: After senior JD(U) leader KC Tyagi claimed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has all qualities needed in a Prime Minister, Kumar on Tuesday dismissed the speculations saying that such talks have no basis. "If somebody says something on any topic, it shouldn't be regarded as the party's official statement," he added. Notably, JD(U) is a BJP ally at the Centre.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Against norms: Cong leader on Maha Guv using Uttarakhand govt plane
text: Congress leader Garima Dasauni said that it was against the norms for Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari to use an Uttarakhand government plane for flying to Dehradun recently. She added that it was a burden on the already debt-ridden state coffers. "Being the Governor of Maharashtra it was the Maharashtra government's responsibility to send Koshyari in state plane," Dasauni said.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Are Taliban terrorists or not?: Omar Abdullah on India-Afghanistan talks
text: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Wednesday asked the Centre to clarify its stance on the Taliban. "Either Taliban are a terror organisation or not, please clarify to us...If they're a terror group, why are you talking to them?" he said. "If not then will you move to UN and have it delisted as a terror organisation?" Abdullah further said.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: He's a child: Owaisi on BJP leader's 'AIMIM like Taliban' remark
text: Responding to BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi's comparison of AIMIM with Taliban, Asaduddin Owaisi said that Ravi is a "child" who knows nothing about international politics. Owaisi added, "Will BJP ban Taliban under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA)? There are two countries in the world who have not banned the Taliban- India and Pakistan."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: ED files chargesheet against 2 WB ministers, 3 others in Narada case
text: Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday filed a chargesheet against Bengal Ministers Firhad Hakim and Subrata Mukherjee, Trinamool Congress MLA Madan Mitra, ex-Kolkata Mayor Sovan Chatterjee and suspended IPS officer SMH Mirza in the Narada sting operation case. A special CBI court ordered the appearance of the accused on November 16. CBI had arrested Hakim, Mukherjee, Mitra and Chatterjee in May.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Curbs on Vinayaka Chaturthi but state liquor shops can open?: TN BJP chief
text: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai has questioned the state government's decision to prohibit the public celebration of Vinayaka Chaturthi amid COVID-19. He said, "Vinayaka Chaturthi is part of our lives. We are allowing TASMAC (state-owned liquor shops) to function in our states...Why ban Vinayaka Chaturthi procession alone?...Issuing a blanket ban is unacceptable."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: AIMIM is like Taliban of K'taka: BJP's CT Ravi ahead of Kalaburagi polls
text: When asked about Asaduddin Owaisi-led All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen's credentials for upcoming corporation polls in Kalaburagi, BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi said, "AIMIM is like the Taliban of Karnataka." Ravi said, "The issues of Taliban, AIMIM, and SDPI are same...Taliban won't be accepted in Kalaburagi." Elections for Kalaburagi City Corporation will be held on September 3.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Don't live in cuckoo world: Farooq tells Centre on terrorism in J&K
text: National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said terrorism still exists in J&K and added Centre shouldn't live in a cuckoo world. "These panchayat members are targets of militants and they need to be protected. Don't live in a cuckoo world and think everything is hunky-dory," he said. Abdullah urged L-G Manoj Sinha to strengthen the security of panchayat leaders.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: UPA's core agenda was corruption, nepotism, policy paralysis: BJP
text: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks over rising prices of cooking gas, diesel and petrol. Patra alleged the Congress-led UPA followed the core agenda of 'CNP' - "Corruption, nepotism and policy paralysis". Rahul had earlier said, "Modi Ji keeps saying that GDP is rising. I then understood what he means by GDP. It means 'Gas-Diesel-Petrol'."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Pandit Nehru not included among freedom fighters' pics on govt website
text: Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's picture has been excluded from among pictures of prominent leaders of India's freedom struggle, displayed in an 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' banner on a government website. The banner, displayed on ICHR's website, includes images of Mahatma Gandhi, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, Veer Savarkar and others. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised the 'omission', calling it "petty".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Regret that my party didn't participate in J&K panchayat polls: Farooq
text: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah Tuesday expressed regret that his party didn't participate in the 2018 panchayat polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The NC also boycotted the Block Development Council (BDC) polls held in 2019. Abdullah, however, exuded confidence that soon a government will be formed in J&K which will make officials answerable to people.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Pak govt used images from India to show 'fake prosperity', says Pak MP; shares pics
text: Member of Pakistan's National Assembly Marriyum Aurangzeb has said that the PM Imran Khan led-Pakistan government used images from India to "show fake development and prosperity". She shared pictures of brochures printed by the PTI party to showcase PM Khan's government's achievements on its three-year anniversary. She claimed the brochures' images were "stolen" from Indian websites.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Insult to martyrs: Rahul Gandhi on Jallianwala Bagh memorial revamp
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi termed the renovation of the Jallianwala Bagh memorial as an "insult to martyrs". "Only those who do not know the meaning of martyrdom can inflict such an insult on the martyrs of Jallianwala Bagh. I am the son of a martyr - I will not tolerate the insult of martyrs at any cost," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Pandit Nehru will feature in upcoming 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' posters: ICHR
text: After a row over 'omission' of Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's picture in an 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' poster, the Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR) Director has said Pandit Nehru will feature in upcoming posters. The reactions based on just one poster were "premature", said ICHR Director Om Jee Upadhyay, adding, "We're not trying to undermine anyone's role in [freedom] movement."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Repeal farm laws, I'll share laddoos with you: Punjab CM to ML Khattar
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has criticised Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar for blaming Punjab for the farmers’ agitation. Reacting to Khattar’s remarks of farm leaders feeding laddoos to Singh, the latter said, "Repeal the farm laws and not just the farmers, even I'll share laddoos with you." Singh also censured Khattar for trying to defend the Karnal incident.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: BJP MLA Tanmoy Ghosh joins TMC, says 'BJP doing vindictive politics'
text: BJP MLA from West Bengal's Bishnupur, Tanmoy Ghosh, on Monday joined the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress. "BJP is doing vindictive politics. They're attempting to snatch rights of Bengal's people by using central agencies," he said. He was welcomed into the party by West Bengal minister Bratya Basu. Ghosh had switched over to the BJP from TMC in March this year.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Centre asked states to avoid gatherings: Maha CM amid Dahi Handi row
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the central government has asked states to avoid gatherings during Dahi Handi as the third COVID-19 wave is expected. His response came as BJP and MNS protested the ban on Dahi Handi festivities. "People are trying to be heroes after organising a few Dahi Handis. If you want to fight, fight against COVID-19," he said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Congress has become a 'kitty party', people only joke around: Naqvi
text: Reacting to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "friend-monopoly'' remark against government's 'National Monetisation Pipeline', Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said such jokes are the reason why the Congress party has witnessed degradation. "The Congress party...has become a 'kitty party', where their people only joke around," Naqvi added. "What they talk about has no logic and sense," he said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Lathicharge on Haryana farmers akin to second Jallianwala Bagh: Sena
text: Shiv Sena on Monday termed the lathicharge on farmers in Haryana as "second Jallianwala Bagh" and said the state government has no right to remain in power anymore. At least 10 people were injured after the police lathicharged a group of farmers disrupting traffic movement. "The seeds of cruelty being sown by the government will bear sour fruits," Sena added.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Remove Joseph Stalin's pics from party offices: Cong leader to CPI(M)
text: Congress MLA VD Satheesan said that Kerala CPI(M) leaders should remove the photos of Joseph Stalin from their party offices and other places. His statement came after the remains of thousands of people were unearthed in over two dozen graves in Ukraine's southern city of Odessa. Satheesan added that the history of Communist Party is all about dictatorship and genocide.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurates Ramayan conclave in Ayodhya
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday visited Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya and inaugurated a Ramayan conclave. Governor Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath were also present on the occasion. "Without Ram, Ayodhya is not Ayodhya. Ayodhya exists where there is Ram. Lord Ram resides permanently in this city, and hence in the true sense, this place is Ayodhya," the President said.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Police use water cannon after AAP Punjab Women Wing tries entering BJP office
text: Police in Chandigarh on Sunday used water cannon after protesting members of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Punjab Women Wing tried to enter the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Punjab office. Many women workers were later detained by the police. The women's wing also blew the effigy of PM Narendra Modi outside the BJP office.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Goa CM should resign, Governor should dismiss state govt: Ex-CM
text: Former Goa CM and Congress leader Digambar Kamat on Saturday demanded the resignation of CM Pramod Sawant and asked the Governor to "dismiss" the state government over the "deteriorating law and order situation". He added, "The unprecedented rise in criminal activities has sent shivers amongst the Goans...BJP government headed by CM Sawant has transformed Goa into a criminal hub."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Narayan Rane's mental health not well, he should do yoga: Raut
text: A day after Union Minister Narayan Rane threatened to expose Shiv Sena following his arrest and subsequent bail over the 'slap' remark, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that Rane's 'mental health is not well'. He said that Rane should practice yoga, adding that his "egotist and revengeful attitude" has forced BJP on the backfoot.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Is Maha govt taking orders from Taliban?: BJP on Dahi Handi ban
text: The BJP on Monday criticised the Maharashtra government's decision to ban 'Dahi Handi' celebrations on Janmashtami due to COVID-19 and asked, "Why are all restrictions being enforced on Hindu festivals in Maharashtra." BJP MLA Ashish Shelar questioned, "Is this government taking orders from Taliban?". He claimed that the Shiv Sena was compromising on its "Hindutva".
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: ED's notice a love letter for political workers: Shiv Sena's Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Monday said the Enforcement Directorate's notice isn't a "death warrant" but a "love letter" for political workers. Raut made the comments a day after Maharashtra Minister Anil Parab was summoned by ED on Tuesday. "Frequency of such love letters has increased after unsuccessful attempts to breach the wall of Maha Vikas Aghadi," Raut said.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Is BJP supporting people who insult Maharashtra's pride?: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday questioned if BJP was supporting those who "insult" Maharashtra's pride and self-respect. Raut's comment came amid controversy over Union Minister Narayan Rane's 'slap' remark against CM Uddhav Thackeray. Raut alleged that central leaders like BJP chief JP Nadda and Home Minister Amit Shah had called up Rane to express their support to him.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Empowerment of the weak, women most important in democracy: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said the most important work in democracy is the empowerment of the weak, poor and backward women and to give children their rights. "Only when this is done successfully, we can say that elected representatives are discharging their duties cent per cent," Shah added. He was speaking at an event in Gujarat.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: 85% protesters from Punjab, H'yana farmers happily working in fields: Khattar
text: As many as 85% of those who are protesting as part of the farmers' agitation are from Punjab, while Haryana's farmers are "happily working in their fields", said Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar. "Those agitating and taking law and order in their hands are not farmers, they are politically motivated people," Khattar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Assam Cong decides to end ties with Badruddin Ajmal-led AIUDF & BPF
text: The opposition 'Grand Alliance' in Assam is set to collapse with the state Congress on Monday announcing that it has decided to break ties with Badruddin Ajmal-led AIUDF and the Bodoland People's Front (BPF). A core committee meeting observed that AIUDF's "behaviour and attitude in relation with the BJP has baffled the members of Congress", party spokesperson Bobbeeta Sharma said.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Want solution through dialogue: Rajnath Singh on China border row
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday said India wants a solution to the border dispute with China through dialogue and asserted that the government would never allow the sanctity of borders to be violated. Army has shown both courage and restraint while working with great maturity, he added. Singh further said India has learnt a lot from the 1962 war.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: TDP supporters protest against Andhra govt over rising fuel prices
text: TDP supporters and cadres protested against the Andhra Pradesh government over rising fuel prices on Saturday. They protested by pulling a four-wheeler with ropes and moving two-wheelers on rickshaws and bullock carts. Protesters also raised slogans against the YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led state government and alleged that it is not taking any measures to help the poor.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: UP Police books Delhi Dy CM for violating COVID-19 norms at Tiranga Yatra
text: Police have registered a case against 17 AAP leaders, including Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, for violating COVID-19 protocols during the party's Tiranga Yatra in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The FIR also mentions 500 unidentified persons who were part of the yatra on Sunday, police said. Permission had been granted with a limit of 50 people, they added.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Strongly condemn police action on farmers in Haryana: Sharad Pawar
text: Reacting to the police lathi-charge on protesting farmers in Haryana's Karnal district on Saturday, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that it is "absolutely unwarranted". Sharing a picture of a farmer who was injured in the protest, Pawar tweeted, "Despite the peaceful protest...the police launched a lathi-charge on them resulting in many farmers getting injured. I strongly condemn this."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Rajasthan CM discharged from hospital; had 90% blockage in an artery
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, who underwent an angioplasty, was discharged from Jaipur's SMS Hospital on Sunday and was welcomed by his family members at his residence. On Friday, a stent was placed in one of his arteries that had 90% blockage. "I would like to thank all the staff...of SMS Hospital who took good care of me," the CM tweeted.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Bhupinder Hooda, other Cong leaders instigating farmers in Haryana: CM
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Monday slammed Punjab CM Amarinder Singh for demanding his resignation over Karnal incident and alleged that former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda and other Congress leaders are "instigating farmers" in his state. This comes after police lathicharged at farmers in Haryana's Karnal on Saturday. The Punjab CM demanded Khattar's resignation over the lathicharge incident.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Amid infighting, 58 MLAs attend dinner with Punjab CM to show support
text: At least 58 MLAs and eight MPs extended support to Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh at a dinner hosted by his aide Rana Gurmit S Sodhi on Thursday. "They expressed confidence that Congress would win the 2022 (Assembly) polls under Singh's leadership," Sodhi said. The dinner came amid demands by a section of Congress MLAs seeking Singh's removal.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Rajasthan CM to undergo angioplasty, says 'having health issues after COVID-19'
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot took to Twitter and wrote, "Post COVID-19 I was having health issues and since yesterday I was having severe pain in my chest. Just got my CT angio done." "Angioplasty will be done. I am happy that I'm getting it done at SMS Hospital. I am fine and will be back soon," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Punjab Congress chief Sidhu's political advisor Mali resigns after remarks on Kashmir
text: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu's political advisor Malvinder Singh Mali resigned from his post after Congress sought his removal over controversial remarks. Mali suggested that both India and Pakistan were illegal occupants in Kashmir. Mali said if any physical harm is caused to him, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh, Manish Tewari and Sukhbir Singh Badal among others will be responsible.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Abhishek Banerjee, his wife summoned by ED in money laundering case
text: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee and his wife Rujira were summoned by ED for questioning in a money laundering case linked to an alleged coal scam. While Abhishek has to appear on September 6, Rujira has to appear on September 1. "BJP thinks it can [pressure us]...But we'll emerge stronger," said Abhishek on the summons.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP files complaint against Maha CM Uddhav, wife Rashmi after Narayan Rane episode
text: BJP has filed complaints against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, his wife Rashmi Thackeray and Yuva Sena President, seeking FIRs against them. A complaint was filed against Thackeray for allegedly saying he wanted to hit UP CM Yogi Adityanath with a slipper. Another complaint was lodged against Saamana editor Rashmi Thackeray for allegedly using abusive words against Union Minister Narayan Rane.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Allow me to take decisions or I won't spare anyone: Sidhu to Congress
text: Amid reports of infighting in the Punjab Congress, the state party unit's chief Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday told the Congress high-command, "If you don't let me take decisions, I won't spare anyone." Subsequently, when asked about Sidhu's statement, Congress Punjab in-charge Harish Rawat replied, "He is party chief, who other than him can take decisions?"
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Actress and TMC MP Nusrat Jahan blessed with a baby boy
text: Actress and Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Nusrat Jahan has been blessed with a baby boy. Earlier today, she had shared a picture of herself on Instagram, writing, "Faith over fear." In June, Nusrat had said that her marriage to businessman Nikhil Jain is invalid and revealed that she had been living separately from Jain since November 2020.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: BJP's income rose by 50% and yours?: Rahul Gandhi on ADR report
text: Commenting on the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) report, Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "BJP's income rose by 50% in 2019-20. And yours?" According to the ADR report, BJP's total income during 2019-20 was ₹3,623.28 crores. In 2018-19, BJP's income stood at ₹2,410.08 crores. Congress party's income decreased by around 25% from ₹918.03 crores in 2018-19 to ₹682.21 crores in 2019-20.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Why did she go there at 7pm, now Cong trying to rape me: Minister on Mysuru rape case
text: After a woman was allegedly gangraped at the foothills of Chamundi Hills in Mysuru, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said, "What was she doing there at 7pm?" "She shouldn't have gone there. It's an isolated place," he added. Further accusing Congress of politicising the issue, Jnanendra said, "Rape has occurred there. But Congress is trying to rape me."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Rahul Gandhi to visit Chhattisgarh next week: CM Baghel after Delhi meet
text: After meeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday in Delhi, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said Rahul will visit the state next week. Baghel said that there were political and state administrative discussions in the meeting with Rahul. The meeting comes after Baghel and state Health Minister TS Singh Deo met Rahul on Tuesday amid alleged infighting over rotational chief ministership.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Does jijaji own New Delhi Rly Station: FM to Rahul over Monetisation Plan
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday criticised Congress' Rahul Gandhi over his criticism for the National Monetisation plan and said that Congress had brought the Request for Proposal in 2008 for New Delhi Railway Station. "I would want to ask Rahul Gandhi who owns the railway station now. Jijaji (Robert Vadra)?" she said. She claimed Congress sold resources for kickbacks.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Chhattisgarh Congress MLAs called to Delhi amid infighting: Reports
text: All Congress MLAs of Chhattisgarh have reportedly been called to Delhi amid alleged infighting between CM Bhupesh Baghel and Health Minister TS Singh Deo over rotational chief ministership. Meanwhile, on the crisis, Deo said, "There is rivalry even among siblings. Healthy competitions take place." He added any person playing in the team would think about becoming captain.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Alarming situation in Kerala: BJP as state sees 31,445 COVID cases
text: BJP on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in Kerala was alarming and alleged that the state was doing little to mitigate the health crisis. BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said the state government is busy covering it up. "Especially the newsreader turned Health Minister is busy reading the wrong script and spreading disinformation that everything is hunky-dory in Kerala," he added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Tharoor checks on patient during protest against Kerala's COVID-19 handling
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Thursday took part in a symbolic protest by the Indian Youth Congress against the Kerala government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in front of the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. Tharoor was seen checking the health of a man with a stethoscope in a "roadside ICU". "Kerala is in ICU...while the govt charges unaffordable fees," he said.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Take care of yourself, govt busy with 'sales': Rahul on COVID-19
text: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday expressed concern over the rising COVID-19 figures as India registered 46,164 fresh coronavirus cases and urged people to take care of themselves. Criticising the Centre in the same tweet, he added, "GOI is busy with sales." Rahul has been critical of the National Monetisation Pipeline, which was revealed earlier this week.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Resolve inner conflict about caste census: Upendra Kushwaha to BJP
text: Former Union Minister and aide of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, Upendra Kushwaha said that BJP should resolve its "inner conflict" regarding caste census. "Some BJP leaders are speaking in favour, some are speaking against. [BJP] needs to set its house in order," Kushwaha added. He also said that Centre must conduct a caste census in view of popular sentiment.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Disagree with Home Minister's remarks on Mysuru gangrape: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Thursday said he doesn't support state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra's remarks about the alleged Mysuru gangrape case, adding that he has advised him to give a clarification. Earlier, Jnanendra asked why did the victim go to the deserted place at 7 pm. He also said Congress was trying to "rape" him over the issue.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Ex-GJM faction leader to launch new party in Darjeeling
text: Anit Thapa, former General Secretary of Gorkha Janmukti Morcha (GJM) faction said on Friday that he will launch a new political party in Darjeeling next month. "I will make the announcement on September 9. Many intellectuals and literary personalities will join it," said Thapa, who along with his associates, sided with the TMC government in 2017.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: In a first since formation, Mysuru City Corporation gets BJP mayor
text: In a first since the formation of Mysuru City Corporation (MCC) in 1862, BJP corporator Sunanda Palanetra was elected as the new mayor, with 26 votes. BJP was earlier unable to elect its own mayor despite being the single-largest party in the council because Congress and JDS joined hands to stake a claim to the post.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Uttarakhand AAP makes 'jalebis' to protest against ruling BJP
text: The Aam Aadmi Party workers in Uttarakhand's Haldwani made 'jalebis' to protest against the ruling BJP in the state. The AAP said, "This is a symbolic way of registering our protest against the BJP for not fulfilling the promises it had made." AAP's city chief said people will teach a lesson to BJP in the upcoming Assembly elections in Uttarakhand.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Action against Narayan Rane not vendetta politics: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday refuted BJP's allegations that the Maharashtra government is doing vendetta politics for its action against Union Minister Narayan Rane. Raut said the raids conducted by ED against Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh is vendetta politics. Reacting to Rane's "not let Maharashtra become West Bengal" remark, Raut said Bengal is the "lion of the country".
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Shows Talibani mindset: UP minister after posters against AMU V-C
text: Reacting to the posters put up in Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) against Vice-Chancellor Tariq Mansoor for condoling former UP CM Kalyan Singh's demise, BJP leader Mohsin Raza said that it shows the "Talibani mindset". He added that the Yogi government will take action against such people. "Praying for a criminal is an unforgiving crime," the posters read.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Forces won't let turmoil in other country affect India: LS Speaker
text: Referring to the crisis in Afghanistan, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said on Thursday that armed forces wouldn't let political turmoil in any other country affect India. "We have full faith in our armed forces," he added. Birla is on a week-long trip to J&K and Ladakh as part of 'Parliamentary Outreach Programme for the Empowerment of Panchayati Raj Institutions'.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Amit Shah called father to seek details of arrest: Narayan Rane's son
text: Narayan Rane's son Nitesh Rane has revealed that Union Home Minister Amit Shah called his father to seek details of his arrest over his alleged remarks against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. "The Home Minister sought to know from Rane the exact details leading to his arrest and how it was carried out," he said. Narayan Rane was arrested on Tuesday.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: UP govt names 2 medical institutions after late leader Kalyan Singh
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to name two medical institutes in the state after late BJP leader and former CM Kalyan Singh. "After the decision, the two institutes would now be known as Kalyan Singh Rajkiya Medical College, Bulandshahr and Kalyan Singh Super Speciality Cancer Institute, Chak Ganjaria, Lucknow," officers at the CMO said.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Detained, stopped from entering Kishtwar: J&K Congress leaders
text: Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) chief GA Mir and its General Secretary Abdul Majid Wani, said that they were detained by the Jammu and Kashmir Police at different locations and were prevented from entering Kishtwar. Both the Congress leaders were on their way to Kishtwar to meet Youth Congress workers who were allegedly injured in police lathicharge.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: CBI registers 9 cases related to post-poll violence in WB: Report
text: The CBI has registered nine cases related to post-poll violence in West Bengal, a report said on Thursday. All the four special units of the investigating agency tasked to probe the cases of violence have reportedly moved their units from Kolkata to crime scenes across the state. More cases are under the process of registration, the report further stated.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: TN BJP General Secy resigns after alleged sexually explicit video chat surfaces
text: Tamil Nadu BJP General Secretary KT Raghavan resigned from the party post on Tuesday after a video chat showing him purportedly engaging in a sexually explicit chat with a woman was uploaded on YouTube. Notably, the video was uploaded by Madan Ravichandran, who joined BJP last year. Raghavan denied the allegations, calling it an attempt to malign his image.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Congress will contest 2022 Punjab polls under leadership of Amarinder Singh: Rawat
text: Congress General Secretary Harish Rawat has said that the party will contest 2022 Punjab elections under the leadership of Captain Amarinder Singh. Rawat's statement comes a day after at least 31 legislators of the Punjab Assembly decided to urge Congress high-command to remove Captain Amarinder Singh from his post. A minister said, "The MLAs have lost confidence in the CM."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Not afraid of anyone: Rane amid controversy over 'slap' remark against Maha CM
text: A day after getting arrested over his 'slap' remark against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Union Minister Narayan Rane said, "I'm not afraid of anyone and I'm not backing out." "My words were an expression of anger against the CM who forgot the year of India's Independence," he added. Rane was granted bail hours after his arrest on Tuesday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Said nothing wrong: Narayan Rane on his 'slap Thackeray' remark
text: Union Minister Narayan Rane on Wednesday stood by his remark about Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and claimed he hasn't "said anything wrong". However, he added, "If (ex-Maharashtra CM) Devendra Fadnavis says it is wrong, then I will accept it." Rane had allegedly said he would slap Thackeray and was arrested on Tuesday over the statement. He got bail hours later.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Won't take coercive action against Narayan Rane: Maha govt to HC
text: The Maharashtra government on Wednesday informed the Bombay High Court it would not take any coercive action against Union Minister Narayan Rane in an FIR registered against him in Nashik over his remarks against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. Rane was arrested by Nashik Police on Tuesday and got bail hours later. He had allegedly said he would slap Thackeray.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Rename 'Miyaganj' to 'Mayaganj': Unnao DM in proposal to UP govt
text: Unnao DM Ravindra Kumar has sent a letter to a senior official of Uttar Pradesh's Panchayati Raj Department seeking to rename 'Miyaganj' block to 'Mayaganj'. He said the gram panchayat has proposed changing the name. Kumar's letter reportedly mentions that the name change proposal was initiated after Safipur BJP MLA Bamba Lal Diwakar wrote a letter in this regard.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: After Narayan Rane gets bail, son tweets 'karara jawab milega' scene from 'Raajneeti'
text: After Union Minister Narayan Rane was granted bail on Tuesday, his son Nitesh tweeted a video showing a scene from the film 'Raajneeti'. In the scene, actor Manoj Bajpayee is warning, "Karara jawab milega (Befitting reply will be given)." Rane was arrested for saying he wanted to slap Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray for not remembering the year of India's independence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Maha CM's 'hit with chappal' remark for UP CM Yogi resurfaces after Rane's arrest
text: After Union Minister Narayan Rane's arrest over his "slap" remark against Uddhav Thackeray, the Maharashtra CM's old remark against UP CM Yogi Adityanath is going viral. In 2018, a year before becoming the CM, Thackeray had said, "He's a yogi so he should give up everything...He wore chappals while garlanding Shivaji. I felt like hitting him with the same chappal."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BJP worker fights Shiv Sena members who attacked office; Puri shares clip
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday shared a video of a BJP worker who fought against a group of Shiv Sena workers who attacked the party's office in Kalyan, Maharashtra, over Narayan Rane's "would slap Uddhav Thackeray" remark. "Where are the FIRs?" Puri asked. Meanwhile, BJP felicitated the worker for his "courage". "I'll never be scared," the worker said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Union Minister Rane gets bail hrs after arrest over 'slap' remark against Maha CM
text: Hours after being arrested over his "slap" remark against Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday, Union Minister Narayan Rane was granted bail by a magistrate court in Raigad district's Mahad. Rane was arrested by the Nashik City Police earlier today and produced before the court. A sessions court in Ratnagiri had rejected his transit anticipatory bail application.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Union Minister's blood sugar level rose above 500 after arrest, treated inhumanly: BJP
text: BJP's Maharashtra unit President Chandrakant Patil on Wednesday said that Union Minister Narayan Rane was given inhuman treatment after his arrest. "He was not allowed to even have his afternoon meal...His blood sugar level and blood pressure had shot up beyond 500, yet no medical treatment was provided to him," Patil stated. Rane was granted bail on Tuesday night.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Video shows Maharashtra minister asking police force to arrest Narayan Rane
text: A video clip has surfaced online which apparently shows Maharashtra Transport Minister Anil Parab ordering police officers to arrest Union Minister Narayan Rane. "Hello, what are you people doing? Have you detained him or not?...what order are they asking for? High Court and sessions court have rejected his bail...then use the police force," Parab is heard saying on phone.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Such remarks on PM would be called treason: Sena on Rane's 'slap' remark
text: Commenting on Union Minister Narayan Rane's arrest following his remarks about "slapping" Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Shiv Sena said that such remarks against PM Narendra Modi would be called "treason". "If anybody had used such language against the PM, he'd have been imprisoned for 'treason'," Sena added. "Rane seems to have taken a 'supari' for the CM," it stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Gupkar alliance reiterates demand for restoration of J&K statehood
text: The People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) on Tuesday demanded the restoration of J&K's special constitutional position as it was before August 5, 2019, the day when Article 370 was abrogated. It added that it will continue the fight to seek the rights guaranteed by the Constitution. The parties comprising PAGD held a meeting at NC chief Farooq Abdullah's residence.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Nadda criticises Cong over remarks of Sidhu's aides on Pak, Kashmir
text: BJP chief JP Nadda on Tuesday criticised Congress over recent statements made by Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu's aides and urged the party leadership to clarify its stance on Kashmir and Pakistan. "Recent comments by Punjab Congress leaders...are reprehensible...Silence on the matter will be seen as implicit support to such objectionable remarks," he added in his tweets.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Save apple farmers from open loot by corporates: Himachal Cong chief
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress President Kuldeep Singh Rathore on Wednesday demanded that the government save the state's apple growers from "open loot by the Adani Group". Rathore claimed that the Adani Agri Fresh company had reduced the procurement rate of apples by ₹16. He also alleged that the present BJP dispensation has withdrawn all subsidy benefits from the farmers.
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: No dissent in Punjab Congress: Rawat after meeting party leaders
text: Congress leader Harish Rawat quashed rumours of infighting in Punjab Congress and said that MLAs and ministers are not against anyone. He said, "Four ministers and three MLAs met me and expressed their concerns...about our chances of victory in the Assembly elections." Earlier, these leaders reportedly said that they have lost faith in Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Jaitley had given written assurance for caste-based census: Lalu
text: Reiterating the demand for a caste-based census, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav on Wednesday said that late BJP leader Arun Jaitley had given a written assurance on the matter. He added, "When I was MP, other leaders like Mulayam Singh Yadav and Sharad Yadav along with me fought in Lok Sabha for a caste-based census...We are very hopeful about it."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Will step down when Sonia and Rahul Gandhi order: Chhattisgarh CM
text: Amid reports that Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel will step down from his post, Baghel said that he will do so when Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi order him. "Those talking about 2.5 years plan are trying to bring political instability but will never succeed," he added. Baghel made the remark after meeting former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi.
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Union Minister Rane a dog kept by BJP to attack others: Sena MLA
text: Shiv Sena MLA Santosh Bangar on Wednesday said Union Minister Narayan Rane is a pug dog domesticated by the "Beimaan Janata Party" to attack others. "But I want to tell BJP that it should beware of this dog as it will bite you," Bangar said. His comments came amid a controversy over Rane's "slap" remark against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP MP Hans Raj Hans discharged in fake election affidavit case
text: A Delhi court on Wednesday discharged BJP leader Hans Raj Hans, who was accused of filing a false election affidavit in the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. The court observed that "no prima facie case is made out". The police chargesheet stated that Hans had "provided ambiguous information in respect of his educational qualification, tax liabilities, of him and his family".
author: Jigyasu Joshi

headlines: Won't let Maharashtra become Bengal: Union Minister Narayan Rane
text: Union Minister Narayan Rane, who is out on bail after being arrested over his 'slap' remark against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, on Wednesday said, "We won't let Maharashtra become West Bengal." The Maharashtra government today told the Bombay High Court that no coercive action will be taken till September 17 against Rane in an FIR registered against him in Nashik.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Lokur panel won't proceed with Pegasus probe for now: Bengal govt
text: The West Bengal government on Wednesday told Supreme Court that the commission, headed by Justice MB Lokur, set up by the state to probe into the Pegasus snooping claims wouldn't proceed with its hearing for now. The court had expressed its disapproval with the constitution of the commission as the court was hearing a batch of petitions on the matter.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Country run by laws: Narayan Rane after getting relief from HC
text: Union Minister Narayan Rane on Wednesday said the verdict in all cases filed in the Bombay High Court against him over his 'slap' remark against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has come in his favour. The minister said, "This is an indication that the country is run by laws." Rane was arrested on Tuesday and granted bail in the evening.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: People of North Bengal will decide on separate state: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Nisith Pramanik on Tuesday said that people of North Bengal have faced apathy for decades and they'll decide whether they want a separate state. Pramanik's comments came two months after BJP's John Barla demanded a separate state or UT comprising districts of North Bengal. Pramanik added, "There is no such thing as legitimate or illegitimate about this demand."
author: Navashree Nandini

headlines: Shiv Sena workers vandalise Pune mall owned by Narayan Rane; video surfaces
text: Members of the Shiv Sena on Tuesday vandalised Pune's R Deccan Mall, which is owned by Union Minister Narayan Rane, a video of which has surfaced. The clip shows visibly angry Shiv Sena workers raising slogans against Rane and throwing stones at the building. Rane sparked a controversy after he allegedly said he would slap Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: File FIR against Thackeray for remarks on Adityanath: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Nitin Bhutada on Wednesday urged the Maharashtra Police to file an FIR against state CM Uddhav Thackeray over his alleged remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath. "He (Yogi) should be slapped with his chappal (footwear). Yogi has insulted Shivaji Maharaj," Bhutada's application quoted Thackeray as saying. He claimed the comments can trigger riots in the society.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Partha Chatterjee suspended from TMC after being sacked from Bengal Cabinet
text: The Trinamool Congress on Thursday suspended Partha Chatterjee, who has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a school jobs scam in West Bengal. He has also been suspended from the post of General Secretary, National Vice President and three other roles, TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee announced. Chatterjee was earlier sacked from the West Bengal Cabinet.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rahul Gandhi shares video of Rajasthan boy bowling using fishing net, asks CM to help him
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has retweeted a video of a 16-year-old Rajasthan boy bowling using a fishing net and asked CM Ashok Gehlot to help him. Gandhi tweeted, "Amazing talent is hidden in every nook and corner of our country, it's our duty to recognise and promote them." Gehlot said, "Sure, will take it further and will do the needful."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Will apologise to Prez not to 'pakhandis': Adhir on 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday said that he will apologise to President Droupadi Murmu but not to "pakhandis" (hypocrites). He also accused the BJP of making a "mountain out of a molehill" over the issue. "I inadvertently used the word 'Rashtrapatni' just once and it was a slip of the tongue," Chowdhury added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I have been framed, I'm a victim of conspiracy: Partha Chatterjee
text: A day after being sacked as West Bengal minister, Partha Chatterjee stated that he has been framed. Chatterjee, who has also been suspended from Trinamool Congress, added, "I'm a victim of conspiracy." This comes after Enforcement Directorate arrested him in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. ED has recovered cash worth ₹50 crore from his aide Arpita Mukherjee's premises.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Cong MPs say Sonia was verbally assaulted in LS, seek Speaker's intervention
text: Congress MPs, including Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, have claimed that BJP MPs subjected Congress leader Sonia Gandhi to "outrageous misdemeanour" in Lok Sabha on Thursday. The Congress MPs have sought Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla's intervention to send the matter to Privilege Committee. They claimed a group of MPs surrounded Sonia Gandhi and subjected her to "verbal assault and physical intimidation".
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Delete tweets on Smriti Irani's daughter within 24 hours: HC to 3 Congress leaders
text: The Delhi High Court has asked Congress leaders Jairam Ramesh, Pawan Khera and Netta D'souza to delete, within 24 hours, their tweets on allegations against BJP's Smriti Irani and her daughter in connection with a restaurant in Goa. They have been also asked to appear before the court on August 18 in the defamation case filed by Irani.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: My party takes strict action: WB CM after removal of Partha Chatterjee
text: After Partha Chatterjee was relieved of his duties as the minister in charge of various departments in West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "My party takes strict action." "I've removed Partha Chatterjee as a minister...There are many plannings behind it...I don't want to go into details," she said. Partha Chatterjee was arrested by ED in the alleged SSC recruitment scam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: A matter of great concern on land of Gandhi, Patel: Rahul on Guj hooch tragedy
text: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has commented on Gujarat's hooch tragedy, which has claimed the lives of over 40 people. "In 'dry state' Gujarat, many houses were destroyed due to the consumption of spurious liquor. Drugs worth billions are also...recovered," Rahul said. He added, "It is a matter of great concern, on the land of Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will put facts: Jairam on HC summons over defamation suit filed by Irani
text: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said he will present facts before the court on the matter pertaining to charges against BJP leader Smriti Irani's daughter. His comments came after Delhi HC summoned him along with Pawan Khera and Netta D'Souza on a civil defamation suit filed by Irani. "We'll challenge and disprove the spin being put out by...Irani," Ramesh tweeted.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: WB Minister Partha Chatterjee has luxury flat just for dogs: Meenakshi Lekhi
text: Union Minister Meenakshi Lekhi on Thursday claimed that West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, arrested in the SSC scam case, owns a luxury flat in Kolkata just to keep his dogs. "[Chatterjee's aide] Arpita Mukherjee said money used to go from the bottom to the top. It's understood who is the lower one, but who is the upper one?" Lekhi added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Suspended MPs ate tandoori chicken before Gandhi statue: BJP spokesman
text: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that some of the suspended Rajya Sabha MPs protesting at Parliament complex ate/served tandoori chicken in front of Mahatma Gandhi's statue. "Gandhiji had staunch views on the slaughter of animals," he said. PTI reported that Opposition parties arranged "idli-sambar, tandoori chicken and gajar ka halwa" for suspended MPs who protested overnight.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Adhir Chowdhury has hurt dignity of President with his remark: Rijiju
text: After Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Thursday said his remark has hurt dignity of the President. "Not only he but the entire Congress party and its President Sonia Gandhi, should apologise," Rijiju said. "We've been seeing Congress' comments since the day she was nominated for the post," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Sonia was targeted in Parliament, govt must apologise: Adhir Chowdhury
text: Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said the Central government must apologise to Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi for targeting her in the Parliament on Thursday. "I am at the centre of this controversy. But the BJP is attacking Sonia Gandhi," Chowdhury said, referring to the ongoing 'Rashtrapatni' remark controversy. BJP has accused Sonia of sanctioning the humiliation of President Murmu.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Declare J&K, PoK world peace zones, let SAARC invest here: Mufti
text: PDP's Mehbooba Mufti has urged PM Narendra Modi to declare Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) as 'world peace zones' and enable SAARC countries to invest in the regions. "Let [SAARC nations] open their banks...[and] their handicraft industries [here]," Mufti said. She also urged the government to connect J&K to other parts of the world.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: YouTuber held for uploading 'fake' post of Punjab Tourism Minister
text: A YouTuber named Ravinder Singh Vajidpur was arrested for uploading a "fake" post featuring Punjab Tourism Minister Anmol Gagan Maan. Vajidpur runs the 'Khalsa TV Channel' on YouTube. In a complaint to the police, Aam Aadmi Party worker Sukhwinder Singh alleged that the channel owner had uploaded a "fake" post, where Maan is purportedly seen criticising BR Ambedkar's policies.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: RSS ministers eat everything in private: TMC MP on tandoori chicken row
text: Reacting to BJP's criticism of suspended Rajya Sabha MPs eating tandoori chicken before Mahatma Gandhi's statue in Parliament, TMC MP Susmita Dev said that "RSS [ministers] eat everything behind closed doors". "They can't tolerate that the food [was] brought...by other MPs, they're scared of this solidarity," she added. Several MPs began 50-hour protest there against their suspension on Wednesday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Uddhav faction moves SC against recognition of new LS floor leader
text: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction has moved Supreme Court, contesting Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla's decision to recognise removal of its lawmakers from key posts in the Lower House. The petition demands cancellation of Rahul Shewale as the party's new Floor Leader and Bhavana Gawali as Chief Whip. This plea joins several others filed by the party's two factions.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: TMC busy saving the family like Cong: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on SSC scam
text: Amid allegations of involvement of former TMC leader Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Thursday said the party is busy saving the family and their leader like Congress. "Now Mamata ji, her nephew and the government all are busy saving the family," Dilip Ghosh said. "I don't think anyone will be saved," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Respect has to be given to the institution: Manish on 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: After Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury referred to President Droupadi Murmu as 'Rashtrapatni', Congress leader Manish Tewari said "respect has to be given and should be accorded [to] that institution". "Lady or Gentleman anyone occupying a constitutional office is equally Hon'ble. No point in getting lost in the maze of gender," Tewari tweeted on Friday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Lulu mall owner has ties with RSS, wants to create communal violence: Azam Khan
text: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan on Thursday claimed that the owner of the Lulu mall in Lucknow has links with the RSS. "Owner of the Lulu mall is the fundraiser of RSS and he wants to create communal violence in the state (Uttar Pradesh)," said Khan. He further alleged that namaz was offered at the mall on the owner's direction.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong believes Nehru-Gandhi family is above law: Tejasvi Surya
text: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya has alleged that the Congress workers believe that the Nehru-Gandhi family is "above the law of the land". "The farce being played out by the Congress on the streets and the railway tracks exposes its DNA," Surya said after being asked about summonses issued to Sonia and Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: 'Rashtrapatni' not slip of tongue by Adhir, he is anti-tribal: Rijiju
text: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday criticised Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury over his 'Rashtrapatni' remark. "It was not a slip of tongue. If you watch the clip, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury clearly [referred to President Murmu as] Rashtrapati twice, then he corrected himself to say 'Rashtrapatni'," said Rijiju. "He is an anti-national and anti-tribal person," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Adhir Chowdhury's statement reflects mindset of Cong: U'khand CM
text: After Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury called President Droupadi Murmu 'Rashtrapatni', Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said his statement reflects the party's mindset. "Under the leadership of PM Modi, entire NDA nominated her for Presidential election and she's the President today. Congress is unable to digest it," Dhami said. They've considered the tribal community their vote bank, he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: FIR filed against Adhir Ranjan for his 'Rashtrapatni' remark in MP
text: The Madhya Pradesh Police on Thursday filed an FIR against Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury for calling President Droupadi Murmu 'Rashtrapatni' in the Parliament. The FIR was filed in Dindori on a complaint submitted by tribal leader and BJP member Om Prakash Dhurve. The BJP leader said the entire tribal community was upset by Chowdhury's comment.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Kerala has become safe haven for radicals: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Thursday said, "Kerala under [CM] Pinarayi Vijayan has become a safe haven for...radical elements linked to PFI and SDPI." The statement comes after it emerged that the killers of Karnataka BJP Yuva Morcha worker Praveen Nettaru allegedly used a motorbike registered in Kerala. The accused are suspected to be members of PFI.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, arrested in SSC recruitment scam, sacked
text: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in the alleged SSC recruitment scam, has been relieved of his duties as the minister in charge of various departments in the state. This comes after the ED said it has seized ₹50 crore in cash and gold jewellery from houses belonging to Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Partha Chatterjee's arrest brought shame, disgrace to all of us: TMC spokesperson
text: Commenting on West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest in teachers recruitment scam, Trinamool Congress (TMC) spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said he has brought "shame and disgrace to all of us". "This proves the level of corruption in TMC and the government," he added. "Chatterjee is saying why he would quit...Why isn't he saying in the public he is innocent?" Ghosh questioned.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Congress MP Adhir calls President Murmu 'Rashtrapatni', BJP MPs protest in Parliament
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury referred to President Droupadi Murmu as 'Rashtrapatni'. Speaking in Lok Sabha, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "Sonia Gandhi, you sanctioned the humiliation of Droupadi Murmu. Sonia ji sanctioned humiliation of a woman in the highest constitutional post." Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also spoke in the Parliament asking him to apologise for his remark.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Theft at Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's house, locals thought it is ED raid: Report
text: A theft was reported at West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's house in South 24 Parganas on Wednesday night. Reports said four masked miscreants came in a mini-truck and looted several items including furniture. Reports added that initially the locals mistook the thieves as another raid by the Enforcement Directorate, which earlier arrested the minister in an alleged teachers recruitment scam.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP MPs circled Sonia like a pack of hyenas: Moitra on Sonia-Smriti spat
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra, while addressing the verbal exchange between Congress President Sonia Gandhi and BJP leader Smriti Irani, said that BJP MPs circled Gandhi like a pack of hyenas. "They had all surrounded her and were shouting at her. How can a 75-year-old in a mask be intimidating to anyone?" Moitra asked.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I'll apologise to President, why is Sonia Gandhi being dragged in it?: Cong MP Adhir
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday said, "I can't even think of insulting the President. It was just a mistake. If the President felt bad, I will personally meet her and apologise." He added, "They can hang me if they want. I am ready to get punished but why is she (Sonia Gandhi) being dragged in this?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: ₹29 crore cash, 5 kg gold found at another house of TMC Minister's aide Arpita Mukherjee
text: The Enforcement Directorate has found ₹29 crore in cash and 5 kg gold from another house of West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee near Kolkata. The recovery comes days after the ED seized ₹21 crore in cash from another location linked to Mukherjee. Partha Chatterjee and Arpita Mukherjee were arrested in teachers recruitment scam.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: No question of apologising, mistakenly said 'Rashtrapatni': Cong MP on remark on President
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday said that there is no question of apologising, claiming that he had mistakenly referred to President Droupadi Murmu as "Rashtrapatni". He added, "Now if you want to hang me for it, then you can...the ruling party, in a deliberate design, is trying to make a mountain out of a molehill."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Will adopt Yogi's model in Karnataka if required: CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the state will adopt his UP counterpart Yogi Adityanath's model to deal with communal forces if required. In Karnataka, there are many regulating mechanisms, but if the need arises, Yogi's model would be taken up, he said. This comes after a BJP Yuva Morcha worker was killed by two bike-borne attackers in Dakshina Kannada.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Suspended RS MPs continue 50-hr relay protest, spend night at Parliament complex
text: The suspended Rajya Sabha MPs continued their 50-hour-long relay protest as they were seen sitting near the Gandhi statue in the Parliament complex on Thursday morning. They spent the first night inside the Parliament complex on Wednesday as part of their protest against their suspension. "21 hours done, 29 hours to go," TMC’s Derek O’Brien tweeted on Thursday morning.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Public is seeing your conduct: Union Minister to suspended MPs on protest
text: As 20 Rajya Sabha MPs, who were suspended for creating ruckus, are holding a 50-hour-long protest, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said public is seeing their conduct when the government is ready for discussion. "This isn't right," he added. "Sit here from morning to evening, then go home...take rest. Come back the next day and then continue your protest," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Deliberate sexist insult: Sitharaman on Adhir Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Union Finance Minister on Thursday said that it was a "deliberate sexist insult". "Sonia Gandhi should apologise to the President of India and the country," Sitharaman added. "In every way, Congress party has been attempting to undermine a tribal, self-made and successful leader," she stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He has already apologised: Sonia on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: After several BJP leaders demanded an apology from Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury for his ‘Rashtrapatni’ remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said he has already apologised. Earlier today, Chowdhury said, “There is no question of apologising. I had mistakenly said ‘Rashtrapatni’...the ruling party…[is] trying to make mountain out of a molehill.”
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 3 more RS MPs suspended, taking total number of suspended MPs in Parliament to 27
text: Three more Rajya Sabha MPs, including AAP MPs Sushil Kumar Gupta, Sandeep Pathak and Independent MP Ajit Kumar Bhuyan, were suspended on Thursday for remainder of this week for disrupting House proceedings, Deputy Chairman Rajya Sabha Harivansh Narayan Singh said. Total 27 MPs, including 23 Rajya Sabha MPs and four Lok Sabha MPs, have been suspended during ongoing monsoon session.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Partha should be removed from all party posts immediately: TMC’s Kunal Ghosh
text: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Thursday said West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee should be removed from ministry and all party posts immediately. "He should be expelled," he added. "If this statement is considered wrong, the party has every right to remove me from all posts," he stated. On Wednesday, Ghosh said Chatterjee's arrest brought "shame to all of us".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray celebrates 62nd birthday with party workers at Matoshree
text: Shiv Sena party chief Uddhav Thackeray, who turned 62 on Wednesday, celebrated his birthday with party workers at his residence Matoshree in Bandra East. This is an annual ritual of the party but it was disrupted for the last two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Shiv Sainiks from across Maharashtra brought flowers, garlands, bouquets, posters, etc for Uddhav.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Adhir's remark on President shameful, Congress should apologise: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu is "most shameful and condemnable". "Congress should abandon its casteist mindset," Mayawati tweeted and asked the party to apologise for Chowdhury's remark. Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha witnessed protests by BJP members against Chowdhury's remark today.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Union Minister seeks NIA probe into K'taka BJP youth leader's murder
text: Union Minister Shobha Karandlaje has written a letter to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking NIA probe into Karnataka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru's murder. In her letter, Karandlaje blamed organisations like Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) for Nettaru's murder. She further accused them of trying to disrupt the harmony in Dakshina Kannada district.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: He didn't even get chance to speak in Parliament: Cong leader on Adhir's remark
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu, party leader Gurjeet Singh Aujla said he has already apologised for his statement. "The government doesn't have anything to say in the Parliament...they are making an issue of his statement," Aujla added. "He (Adhir) did not even get a chance to speak in the Parliament," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: TMC now only chants 'money' instead of 'Maa, Maati, Manush' slogan: BJP
text: BJP criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's alleged involvement in the SSC scam and asked why is Banerjee silent in the matter. "I want to remind the people...that those who used to raise the slogan of Maa, Maati, Manush, today they are chanting only one word - money, money, money," BJP's Meenakashi Lekhi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Congress maliciously targeting President: Irani on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani criticised Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu by saying that his remark humiliates the dignity of that highest constitutional post. "Ever since Droupadi Murmu was nominated for the Presidential post she has been targeted maliciously by Congress and the attacks don't seem to stop even after she is elected," she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Sonia Gandhi should apologise for appointing someone like Adhir: Union Minister
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s ‘Rashtrapatni’ remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Thursday said that he should immediately apologise for his remark. "Sonia Gandhi should also apologise for appointing someone like him," Joshi added. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also spoke in the Parliament asking him to apologise.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No question of apologising, 50-hr-long protest by MPs to continue: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Mausam Noor on Thursday said that the 50-hour-long protest staged by the MPs against their suspension from the Rajya Sabha will continue. "There’s no question of apologising. We want to have discussions on price rise...but we were suspended," she added. This comes after Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that their suspension can be revoked if they apologise.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He said that deliberately, repeated twice: Goyal on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's claim that he made the 'Rashtrapatni' remark by mistake, is false, as he said it "deliberately" and "repeated it twice". "This country will never tolerate this insult to our tribal people. After all that, he says that there is no need to apologise for this," Goyal added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: When BJP was in Oppn, they said creating ruckus is part of democracy: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday said it’s their right to raise issues in the Parliament. "Back when the BJP was in the Opposition, they would say that creating ruckus is also part and parcel of democracy. Now, they are asking us to apologise," he added. "When we don't even get a chance, some [people] cause ruckus," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Adhir Chowdhury's remark anti-tribal, anti-women: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan called Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury's remark against the newly-elected President of India, Droupadi Murmu, "anti-tribal" and "anti-women".
