"He has insulted the highest office of the country with his statement. This is a manifestation of the worst mentality of him and his party," Chouhan tweeted. "Congress has [always] exploited tribal society," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: He was our only son, culprits should be hanged: Deceased BJP youth worker’s mother
text: The mother of BJP Yuva Morcha worker Praveen Nettaru, who was hacked to death in Karnataka, has demanded strict action against the culprits, saying that the killers should be hanged. "He was our only son and had planned to build a home for us. Now, who'll build it?...Culprits should be punished, whoever did this must be hanged," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 21 TMC MLAs are in direct touch with me: Bengal BJP's Mithun Chakraborty
text: West Bengal BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty on Wednesday claimed that 21 TMC MLAs are in direct touch with him in the state. "Do you want to hear breaking news? At this moment, 38 TMC MLAs have very good relations with us," he said in Kolkata. "Rest, you make the calculations," Mithun added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Central govt wants to crush journalism: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday claimed that the BJP-led central government wants to crush journalism. "It's no secret that GOI wants to crush the...backbone and fourth pillar of our democracy because of its intolerance to...truth," Mufti tweeted. Her remarks came after authorities stopped Kashmiri journalist, Aakash Hassan, from travelling to Sri Lanka to cover the ongoing crisis there.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Was ready to leave MVA, join hands with BJP to convince rebels: Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said that as part of his final attempts to convince rebel MLAs, he was ready to leave the MVA alliance. Thackeray said he would've joined hands with BJP after getting clarifications on three points, including "misuse" of central agencies against Shiv Sainiks. "[Rebels] had no courage to tell me the reasons [for leaving]," Thackeray added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ideological opponents shouldn't be treated as personal opponents: Cong leader
text: Ideological opponents in a democracy should not be treated as personal opponents, Congress leader Anand Sharma said on Wednesday. His statement comes as Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED for questioning in connection with the National Herald case today. "Weaponisation of laws and their use to target has been going on," Sharma added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Only a spineless govt hides behind police: Cong after protesting MPs detained
text: Amid protests by Congress against ED’s questioning of party chief Sonia Gandhi, several Congress MPs were detained by the Delhi Police from Vijay Chowk on Wednesday. "Only a spineless and coward government hides behind the police force," Congress tweeted. "This is how our MPs and leaders are treated under the draconian [PM] Modi rule," Congress added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Dhankhar said he will not spare Partha Chatterjee: TMC leader
text: Trinamool Congress leader Kunal Ghosh has recalled a recent incident when former Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar told him that "he will not spare (Partha) Chatterjee" for an attack on his wife. The comments came as West Bengal Commerce Minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested three days ago in an alleged teachers’ recruitment scam. Jagdeep Dhankhar is the NDA's vice-presidential candidate.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: More cash recovered from Arpita's premises, ED brings counting machines
text: The Enforcement Directorate conducted fresh raids on four premises linked to West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's aide, Arpita Mukherjee, in an alleged teacher recruitment scam case on Wednesday. Cash counting machines were brought at her residence after the ED recovered a huge amount of cash from the premises, ANI reported. Earlier, the ED recovered ₹21.9 crore cash from Mukherjee's flat.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Former Assam minister Ardhendu Dey dies aged 84
text: Former Assam minister Ardhendu Kumar Dey died at a hospital on Wednesday following a brief illness, his family said. The 84-year-old former Congress minister was undergoing treatment at Gauhati Medical College and Hospital, they added. His mortal remains were taken to his residence at Hojai, where the last rites were performed. Dey was first elected as Hojai MLA in 1991.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Had govt spent 4 hrs on debates, 5 days wouldn't have been wasted: Kharge
text: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha, Mallikarjun Kharge, said that if the central government had spent four hours on discussions, five days of Parliament's Monsoon session wouldn't have gone to waste. "Our demand is a discussion under rule 267, suspending business...they could have taken up a discussion under some other rule...It's clear they don't want a discussion," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong protesters stop Gujarat-bound train in Mumbai as ED probes Sonia
text: A group of 10-15 Youth Congress workers stopped a Gujarat-bound train on Mumbai's Borivali station on Wednesday morning to protest against the questioning of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). A video showed protesters raising slogans against PM Narendra Modi. Police officials said some of the protesters were detained and the train departed for its onward journey.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: He's mentally ill: TMC MP on Mithun's '38 MLAs in touch with BJP' claim
text: TMC MP Santanu Sen on Wednesday said BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty has "some mental problem" after the latter claimed that 38 TMC MLAs "have very good relations" with BJP. "[Chakraborty] was admitted for some physical ailment for a long period of time...As a doctor, I feel he must be having some mental problem...That's why he's saying [these things]," Sen said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED has created terror, being used to topple govts: Gehlot
text: The ED has created "terror" in country, Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot said on Wednesday. "ED is being used to topple governments," Gehlot added. "First they summoned Rahul Gandhi. He was interrogated for several hours in five days. Sonia Gandhi has been summoned for the third time today. We've no idea how long it would last," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress protesting to protect a family, not country: Nadda
text: The Congress party is protesting to protect a family, not the country, BJP President JP Nadda said on Wednesday. "Congress protests are not 'Satyagrah' but an attempt to hide the truth…Gandhis required to answer the investigation agencies...they think they are above the law," he added. "Congress party's attempt to keep one family above the law will not work," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He inspires me to be better each day: Aaditya's Insta post on father's birthday
text: Former Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray wished his father Uddhav Thackeray on his birthday and shared a picture of the father-son duo. Taking to Instagram, Aaditya wrote, "Wishing my father and my leader a very happy birthday. He inspires me each day to be better at everything I do, more so, in an honest and kind way."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP workers glue PM Modi's photos on Chess Olympiad posters in TN
text: BJP workers glued PM Narendra Modi's photos on hoardings advertising the 44th Chess Olympiad in Chennai. While sharing a video, BJP functionary AP Reddy wrote, "Let me remind [Tamil Nadu CM] MK Stalin that PM Modi is the nation's sole representative." This comes amid protests by BJP leaders over absence of PM Modi's name and image in the Olympiad's advertisements.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sonia Gandhi leaves ED office after 3 hours of questioning
text: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning in connection with the National Herald case concluded for the day on Wednesday. She left the ED office in Delhi after three hours of questioning. There has been no fresh summons issued to her as of now, PTI stated. She was called for the third round of questioning in the case today.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP protests near AAP office over Delhi excise policy irregularities
text: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) workers protested over irregularities in Delhi government's excise policy implementation outside the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) office. BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma led the protests, and he alleged that AAP government made Delhi into an "intoxicated capital". However, the police didn't allow the protestors' planned march to the AAP office at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Will resign if govt doesn't take action: BJP MLA on party worker's murder
text: After a BJP Yuva Morcha worker, Praveen Nettaru, was hacked to death by two assailants in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district, BJP MLA MP Renukacharya said he'll resign if action is not taken against the attackers. "What's the use of being in power if we cannot protect...Hindu workers?" Renukacharya tweeted, adding that there was no use for just "Om Shanthi" posts.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: MVA experiment wasn't wrong, Sena will have its CM again: Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, in an interview with 'Saamana', said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance experiment wasn't wrong and people had welcomed it. "The Shiv Sena will have a chief minister again. I will work to expand the party base and cadre," Thackeray said. "If...present rulers fear the Opposition, it's their inefficiency," he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: If MPs belong at police lines, why is new Parliament being constructed?: Cong MP
text: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda on Wednesday said that when MPs raise important issues in Parliament, they are suspended. "During protests, our members are detained and taken to police lines. If MPs belong at police lines, then why is a new Parliament being constructed here?" Hooda asked. This comes as Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before the ED today.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress trying to mislead probe agencies through protests: Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised the Congress and accused the party of "misleading and pressuring" central probe agencies through street protests. Thakur said that cases of rape and murder are increasing in states. "The situation is worrisome in Rajasthan, but the CM is spending time here," he said. Congress has never shied away from attacking democracy, Thakur added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Those guilty must be punished, but media trials unacceptable: Mamata
text: Days after TMC leader Partha Chatterjee was arrested by the ED in connection with a school recruitment scam, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised the media for launching a "malicious campaign" against TMC. "If anyone has committed any mistake, and it is proven legally, he or she must be punished," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Politically motivated: Robert Vadra on ED summons to Congress leaders
text: Following ED summons sent to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and now Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra’s husband Robert Vadra said the move is "politically motivated". "Now when there is GST, inflation, price hike...they have called Mrs Gandhi," he added. "The government is diverting people’s attention to cover-up the statement given by Nupur Sharma that created communal disharmony," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Pray to God for your long and healthy life: Shinde wishes Uddhav on birthday
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday wished former CM Uddhav Thackeray on his birthday and prayed for his good health. Taking to Twitter, Shinde wrote, "Happy Birthday to Hon'ble Shri Uddhavji Thackeray, former Chief Minister of Maharashtra. I pray to Mata Jagdamba for your long and healthy life." Recently, Uddhav compared the rebel MLAs to rotten leaves.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Not easy to break Bengal with central agencies: Mamata amid SSC probe
text: Amid the ongoing probe into the SSC scam, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised the Centre and said it "wasn't easy to break Bengal" with the help of central agencies. "They (BJP) have no work, their job is to take over the state governments through 3-4 agencies," Mamata said. "They've taken Maharashtra...but Bengal has defeated them," she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Congress govt in Raj under control of mafias: BJP leader Tarun Chugh
text: BJP leader Tarun Chugh on Tuesday criticised the Ashok Gehlot-led government in Rajasthan, saying the law and order situation has "completely derailed in the state". "The Congress government is under...control of mafias like mining mafia, cheating mafia...on whose behest the government is running," Chugh said. The development of the state has come to a complete standstill, he further claimed.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Congress CMs camping in Delhi instead of managing their states: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress for protesting in Delhi against ED questioning Sonia Gandhi in money laundering case and asked, Why is Congress scared if they haven't done any corruption? "Incidents of rape, murder are being reported from Congress-ruled states, but their CMs are camping in Delhi instead of maintaining law and order in their respective states," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Decision to suspend 19 Opp'n MPs from RS taken with heavy heart: Goyal
text: BJP on Tuesday said that the decision to suspend 19 opposition MPs from the Rajya Sabha was taken with a "heavy heart", as they repeatedly ignored the Chair's appeals to let the House function. Leader of the House in the RS, Piyush Goyal, said that India has tackled inflation and price rise better than many countries.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: You paid for it right: Khushbu Sundar to troll saying she got plastic surgery
text: Actress-turned-politician Khushbu Sundar recently posted a picture of herself on social media after losing weight. A troll commented on her post, "Looking good but why from plastic surgery and other skin corrections?" Khushbu replied to the troll's comment, writing, "And you paid for it right my dear? What sadistic pleasures [do] people like you get...at someone's expense? Shame on you."
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Bihar CM tests COVID-19 positive for second time this year
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday and was in home isolation, the Bihar Chief Minister's Office (CMO) said. "He was keeping unwell for the past two-three days. He is in home isolation and doctors have advised him to rest," said the CMO statement. Kumar had earlier contracted the virus in January this year.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: If Guj is dry state, how was alcohol sold: Kejriwal on hooch tragedy
text: After at least 30 people were killed and over 50 people were hospitalised by consuming spurious liquor in Gujarat's Botad district, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal criticised the Gujarat government. "If Gujarat is a dry state, then how is alcohol being sold openly...and who is benefitting from this?" Kejriwal said. "Is there some conspiracy behind this?" Kejriwal questioned.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: These rebels are like rotten leaves of tree, should be shed: Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray compared rebel party leaders to "rotten leaves" of a tree. "These rebels are like rotten leaves of a tree and should be shed. It's good for the tree as there will be new leaves," he added. Furthermore, Thackeray said let there be elections and see whom people choose.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre defaming, tarnishing Cong leaders with fake cases: Kerala LoP
text: Leader of Opposition in the Kerala Assembly, VD Satheesan, accused the BJP-led Central government of defaming and tarnishing the image of Congress leaders through various fake cases. "First, Rahul Gandhi was questioned...and now Sonia Gandhi is again being questioned by the ED," Satheesan said. "It's the agenda of RSS and Sangh Pariwar to eradicate Congress from India," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Democracy was suspended: TMC's Derek O'Brien on action against 19 MPs
text: Trinamool Congress leader Derek O'Brien on Tuesday reacted to the action taken against 19 Rajya Sabha MPs who were suspended till Friday for "misconduct". "PM Modi and Shah have suspended democracy...what are you talking about MPs?" O'Brien was quoted as saying by ANI. Seven TMC MPs including Sushmita Dev, Dola Sen and Mausam Noor have been suspended.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Before announcing reforms govt should consult experts: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Vivek Shejwalkar said that before announcing reforms, the government should consult experts in that field and hold consultations with the affected people so that there is no obstacle in the implementation of public-friendly policies. This will check those who create an “atmosphere of negativity”, Shejwalkar said on Tuesday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not ED's job to form or break a party: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on SSC scam
text: Criticising TMC over the SSC scam, BJP MP Dilip Ghosh said it wasn't the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) job to form or break any party. "The agencies have reached the right places by using the right means, that's why such huge numbers of bundles of...notes are being recovered," Ghosh said. "People who are lying...now, what will the public say?" he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: ED summons TMC MLA Manik in WB teacher recruitment scam case
text: The Enforcement Directorate has issued summons to Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Manik Bhattacharya in connection with the alleged teacher recruitment scam case in West Bengal. The ex-President of West Bengal Board of Secondary Education has been asked to depose before ED officials on Wednesday. Earlier, ED searched his residential premises. ED is probing the money laundering aspect of the scam.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: BJP National General Secretary meets with party members in Tripura
text: BL Santhosh, BJP's National General Secretary, arrived for a two-day visit in Tripura and chaired a meeting with the party members in the state at the BJP headquarters, according to a senior party leader. At the meet, state assembly by-elections were discussed, along with organisational matters. Union Minister Pratima Bhowmik and BJP leader Phanindranath Sharma were present at the meeting.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Charges filed against ex-Punjab minister Singla in corruption case
text: The Mohali Police has filed a chargesheet against former Punjab Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla. The chargesheet has been filed under Section 7 (offence relating to public servant being bribed) and Section 8 (offence relating to bribing of a public servant) of the Prevention of Corruption Act. The AAP leader allegedly sought commission for allotment of funds in government tenders.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: India is a police state, Modi is a king: Rahul after being detained
text: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said India's reality is that "it is a police state" and Prime Minister Narendra Modi "is a 'raja' (king)". Rahul was detained by the Delhi Police for protesting near the Parliament House against ED's questioning of Congress leader Sonia Gandhi. "Discussions are not allowed inside (the Parliament) and here they're arresting us," Rahul added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Immature act: Shivpal on SP's letter giving him freedom to leave party
text: MLA Shivpal Singh Yadav reacted to Samajwadi Party's letter which gave him the freedom to leave party and said, "I think it's immaturity."  "When I contested polls, I resigned from my party and took membership of Samajwadi Party. It would have been better if they would have removed me from the legislature party," Shivpal said on Tuesday.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Congress has never shown any respect for Constitution: Pradhan
text: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan stated that Congress has never shown any respect for the Constitution. Earlier, Rahul Gandhi said India has become a "police state" under PM Narendra Modi. "People who imposed Emergency (in 1975)...it doesn't suit them (to make such allegations)," Pradhan said. Rahul Gandhi even tore an ordinance passed by the then Congress-led Cabinet in 2013, he added.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: J'khand CM's aide sent to 6-day ED remand in money laundering case
text: Pankaj Mishra, a political aide of Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren, was sent to the custody of Enforcement Directorate (ED) for six more days on Tuesday. He has been arrested over money laundering charges related to alleged illegal mining in Jharkhand. Earlier, the ED seized ₹11.88 crore from 37 bank accounts belonging to Mishra and his associate Dahoo Yadav.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: My mistake was to trust people with monstrous ambition: Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray, in his first interview with 'Saamana', after stepping down as CM of Maharashtra, said that his mistake was that he gave authority to leaders who had monstrous ambitions. He also compared rebel leaders to rotten leaves of a tree and asserted that they should be shed. "I'm pained because my people betrayed me," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP opposing Delhi's excise policy will help illegal liquor trade: AAP
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) criticised BJP for opposing the Delhi government's excise policy and accused it of patronising the illicit liquor trade in Gujarat. "They [BJP] unleashed CBI, ED and Income Tax Department on all the licensed liquor shops in Delhi and even targeted the elected government. As a result, a lot of shops were shut," AAP leader said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: There'll be discussion on price rise in Parliament: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said that as compared to many countries in the world, inflation in India is contained. "I am assuring you that there will be a discussion on price rise in Parliament," Joshi added. "FM [Nirmala] Sitharaman who was down with COVID-19 will return in a day or two, then we'll have a discussion," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: If you are showering flowers on Kanwariyas, at least don't bulldoze us: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Yogi Adityanath-led UP government and said that if Kanwariyas are showered with petals, then the authorities should at least spare Muslims from bulldozing their houses. "If a Muslim offers prayers in an open place...it leads to a row," he added. "Why this distinction? Why divert traffic for one religion and bulldoze another?" he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Unfair to suspend 19 MPs for raising questions: TMC's Sushmita Dev
text: TMC MP Sushmita Dev, who is among the 19 MPs suspended from the Rajya Sabha till Friday, said it is unfair to suspend them for raising questions. She added the opposition will protest inside and outside the Parliament. "If the Finance Minister is not well, PM Modi can answer our questions," Dev added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Very unfortunate: TMC's Mausam Noor on suspension of 19 Opp'n MPs
text: TMC MP Mausam Noor, who is among the 19 opposition MPs suspended from the Rajya Sabha till Friday, called it "very unfortunate" and said they only wanted to have discussions on inflation. "Government does not want to have discussions and this is the reason we have been suspended," Noor said. "We will protest outside the parliament," she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Sonia Gandhi reaches ED office in Delhi accompanied by Priyanka
text: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi reached the Enforcement Directorate’s office in New Delhi on Wednesday for the third round of questioning in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied her mother. The Congress chief appeared before the probe agency for the second round of questioning on Tuesday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Youth Congress workers block train in Kerala as ED questions Sonia
text: Youth Congress workers blocked a train in Kerala's Kannur on Tuesday to protest against the questioning of party leader Sonia Gandhi by Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. A video of the incident showed Congress workers raising slogans like, "Sonia Gandhi, the leader, led bravely" and "Narendra Modi ruthless". They were detained following a brief scuffle with police.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Why is Ganga polluted despite spending ₹11,000 cr?: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Tuesday raised questions on the success of the 'Namami Gange' programme. While sharing a video on Twitter, Varun wrote, "Ganga is not just a river for us, (she) is (our) mother. That is why a budget of ₹20,000 crore was allocated for Namami Gange." "Why is it polluted despite spending ₹11,000 crore?" he further asked.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Include Garo & Khasi in Constitution's 8th Schedule: TMC MPs
text: Several Trinamool Congress (TMC) MPs on Tuesday protested near the Parliament, demanding the inclusion of Garo and Khasi languages in the Constitution's Eighth Schedule, which lists the country's official languages. The protesting MPs were seen holding placards listing this demand. As many as 22 languages, including English, Hindi and Bengali, are considered official languages by the Schedule.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP’s view clear on UCC, should be considered as govt’s stand: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday said BJP’s view on the Uniform Civil Code is clear and it should be considered as the government's view as well. "About Uniform Civil Code, you know what our government's thinking is on it. We want that what is our party's ideology should be taken as the country's ideology," Rijiju said in Lok Sabha.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar tests COVID positive, suffering from fever since 4 days
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has tested positive for COVID-19. News agency ANI said that Kumar has been suffering from fever for the last four days. This is the second time in this year that the Chief Minister has tested positive. He had earlier tested positive in January 2022 and had isolated himself at home after advice from doctors.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: 19 Opposition Rajya Sabha MPs suspended till Friday amid protests
text: Nineteen Opposition Rajya Sabha MPs were suspended for the remaining days of the week for "misconduct" by entering the well of the House and sloganeering. Those members who have been suspended include TMC's Sushmita Dev, Dr Santanu Sen and Dola Sen. On Monday, four Congress MPs were suspended from Lok Sabha for the entire monsoon session of Parliament.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Partition was painful, can't India, Pakistan and Bangladesh unite?: Haryana CM Khattar
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Monday said that India, Pakistan and Bangladesh can reunite like Germany's reunification. Describing the Partition during the independence of the country as "painful", the Chief Minister said that the Partition should not have happened, adding, "If East Germany and West Germany can unite, then can't India, Pakistan and Bangladesh unite?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Opposition is keeping political interests above country: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday accused the Opposition of obstructing development works, saying they keep their political interests above that of the country. He further said that the opposition parties couldn't implement decisions taken by them when they were in power. "Now if [decisions] are implemented, they oppose it. People of the country don't like it," PM Modi added.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Rahul, other Cong leaders detained after protest against ED summons to Sonia
text: Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders were detained after they staged a protest against the Enforcement Directorate's summons to party leader Sonia Gandhi. Among those detained are Ranjeet Ranjan, KC Venugopal, Manickam Tagore, Imran Pratapgarhi, K Suresh and others. News agency ANI shared visuals of party workers outside the AICC headquarters in Delhi.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: A lot of times I wonder if I should give up politics, there is more to life: Gadkari
text: While attending an event to honour social worker Girish Gandhi in Nagpur, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "A lot of times I wonder whether I should give up politics. There is more to life than politics." He added, "Today what we're seeing is 100% about coming to power...Is politics for the welfare of the society or about being in government?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi reaches ED office in Delhi; Rahul, Priyanka with her
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi reached the Enforcement Directorate's office in New Delhi for the second round of questioning in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Party leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi accompanied their mother. Heavy security has been deployed outside the All India Congress Committee (AICC) headquarters in the capital amid fear of protests.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong’s Adhir Ranjan asks West Bengal CM to sack Partha Chatterjee
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee urging her to sack state minister Partha Chatterjee from ministership immediately. "This teacher recruitment scam was an open secret and everyone in Bengal knows about this," he wrote. "It was only after the court’s intervention that investigation agencies started acting upon it," Chowdhury stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Meghalaya BJP's Marak framed in prostitution case: State BJP chief
text: After a case was registered against Meghalaya BJP's state Vice-president Bernard N Marak for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Tura, the party's state President Ernest Mawrie asked that all charges be withdrawn, calling the case politically motivated. Condemning the raid, Mawrie requested the government to protect Marak's life. He added that Marak has been unjustly framed and maligned.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Kovind fulfilled BJP's political agenda as Prez: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP president Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said former President Ram Nath Kovind has left behind a legacy during which the country's Constitution was "trampled upon". "Be it scrapping of Article 370, CAA or the unabashed targeting of minorities and Dalits, he (former President Kovind) fulfilled BJP's political agenda at the cost of the Indian Constitution," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Article 370 was a psychological barrier in India's integration: BJP
text: National President of BJP Yuva Morcha Tejasvi Surya on Monday said that Article 370 was a cultural and psychological barrier to India's integration. Kashmir is done with terrorism and is on the path of development after the abrogation of Article 370, Surya said. "When Article 370 was there, the youths of Kashmir were bereft of any opportunities," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: They’re trying to harass Oppn leaders: Shivakumar on Sonia’s ED questioning
text: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before the ED in connection with the National Herald case on Tuesday, Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar said the party is with Sonia and Rahul Gandhi. "They (government) are trying to harass Opposition leaders, we'll fight it…You can't harass us anymore," Shivakumar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: TMC trying to make Partha a scapegoat, entire party structurally corrupt: BJP MLA
text: Following West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest by the ED, BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "What is stopping the state government from sacking Partha Chatterjee as a cabinet minister?" Furthermore, he asked, "Why to blame a few leaders when the entire party is structurally corrupt?" "The TMC is trying to make him a scapegoat," Adhikari stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: MPs carry multiple phones, fear 'big brother' listening to conversations: Alva
text: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva said that there is fear that "big brother" is always watching and listening all conversations between politicians across party lines in "new" India. "MPs & leaders of parties carry multiple phones, frequently change numbers & talk in hushed whispers when they meet," Margaret Alva tweeted.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Never used agencies against PM Modi, Shah during UPA rule: Congress
text: Congress on Monday said that the UPA government never summoned then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi or Amit Shah through any agencies or SIT formed by it. The fact is that the SIT constituted by Supreme Court and High Court had summoned PM Modi, Congress spokesperson Shaktisinh Gohil said. The statement came ahead of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's appearance before ED.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: We shouldn't give importance: Union Minister on Mufti's remark on President
text: After PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti’s remark on former President Ram Nath Kovind, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that we should not give importance to anyone's statement given in a wrong way. Meanwhile, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said, "She is demeaning the outgoing President. This isn't surprising as her track record has always been like this."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Childish allegations: BJP on Margaret Alva's phone tapping allegation
text: Reacting to Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva's allegation that politicians' phones are being tapped, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi called it "childish allegation" and asked why would anybody want to tap her phone. ''She's a senior person and should not make such allegations," he added. Earlier, Alva said that there is fear that "big brother" is always watching and listening.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Centre devaluing Opp'n: Venugopal on Kharge's seat at President’s oath ceremony
text: Congress MP KC Venugopal stated that the way Centre treated Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge at the President's oath ceremony was not acceptable. "It is clearly devaluing the position of the Leader of Opposition," he added. Opposition parties wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman saying Kharge was made to sit in a seat "not commensurate with [his] position".
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Congress thinks it's entitled to indulge in 'dacoity': Sambit Patra
text: BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra on Tuesday claimed the Congress thinks it's entitled to commit "dacoity and no one should question it". "I feel...that for...Congress, the meaning of ED was 'entitlement for dacoity'," Patra said. He also criticised Congress for protesting against party chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the Enforcement Directorate regarding the National Herald case.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: I repeatedly said it's mismatched marriage between BJP, JD(U): RJD leader
text: Bihar's RJD chief Jagadanand Singh said he firmly believes that there is no match between BJP and JD(U). "I repeatedly said it's a mismatched marriage between BJP and JD(U)…It's an opportunistic alliance between them," Singh added. "If Nitish Kumar formed government with BJP by putting all principles aside, then I believe he has separated himself from socialist values," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will remain independent, won't join any other party: Yashwant Sinha
text: Yashwant Sinha, who recently lost the Presidential poll against Droupadi Murmu, said that he will not join any other political party and remain "independent". Sinha said that he is yet to decide on what role he wants to play in public life going ahead. Notably, Sinha resigned from TMC's National Vice-President's post to contest in the Presidential election.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Why should public bear brunt of Bundelkhand Expressway's defects: Akhilesh
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP after a few accidents allegedly due to the potholes on the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh. "Why should the public bear the brunt of the defects...of the Bundelkhand Expressway?... The hurriedness that the BJP had shown to inaugurate it, portions of the expressway got uprooted with [even] greater pace," Akhilesh tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Prez Murmu's dreams, BJP's policies unlikely to go together: CPI MP
text: CPI MP Binoy Viswam on Monday applauded Droupadi Murmu's acceptance speech after taking oath as the country's President but said her dreams and the BJP government's policies are unlikely to go together. In her speech, President Murmu said the country's deprived, poor, Dalits and tribals can see their reflection in her, which is a matter of big satisfaction for her.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt trying to intimidate us by suspending our MPs: Congress
text: Congress on Monday said that the government was trying to "intimidate" it and asserted that the party will not be cowed down. The remark came after Manickam Tagore, TN Prathapan, Jothimani and Ramya Haridas were suspended from the Lok Sabha for displaying placards raising the issues of rising prices of gas cylinders and imposition of GST on essential items.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt suppressing Oppn’s voice: Venugopal ahead of Sonia Gandhi's ED questioning
text: Congress’ KC Venugopal said the party decided to hold a peaceful protest in front of Rajghat on Tuesday and gave an application to Delhi Police for permission but they denied it. This comes as Congress interim President is scheduled to appear before ED today. "It is unfortunate and condemnable. The government is suppressing the opposition’s voice," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP can't break TMC by using central agencies: Mamata on Partha's arrest
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said BJP can't break Trinamool Congress (TMC) with the help of central agencies. Commenting on the arrest of West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, Banerjee said, "If anyone is found guilty, he/she must be punished. But I condemn the malicious campaign against me." She added, "Truth must come out but within a time frame."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Arrest warrant issued against Meghalaya BJP leader who ran 'brothel'
text: A non-bailable arrest warrant has been issued against Meghalaya BJP Vice-President Bernard Marak, who is on the run after being accused of running a "brothel", police said. This comes after six children were rescued and 73 people were arrested following a raid at Marak's farmhouse in Tura. Marak has alleged that he is being targeted by state CM Conrad Sangma.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: My election is proof the poor in India can dream & make it come true: President Murmu
text: President Droupadi Murmu in her first address said, "My election is proof that the poor in India can dream and also make their dreams come true." She added, "I started my journey from a small tribal village in Odisha...it was like a dream for me to get elementary education...I became the first daughter of my village to go to college."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Uddhav camp moves SC against Shinde group's plea to stake claim over Sena
text: Shiv Sena faction led by Uddhav Thackeray has moved the Supreme Court against the Election Commission's proceedings on Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led group's plea for recognition as the real Shiv Sena. The EC had asked Shiv Sena's rival factions to submit documents by August 8 to prove their majority. The Shinde group has also sought claim on party symbol.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Every word in her speech had a meaning, her views are commendable: Gehlot on Prez Murmu
text: After President Droupadi Murmu made her first address to the nation on Monday, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said, "Every word in her speech had a meaning. I am very impressed. The views expressed by a tribal woman are commendable." He added, "I hope she meets the commitment she made to the nation today."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 4 Congress Lok Sabha MPs suspended for entire monsoon session amid protests
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday suspended four Congress MPs for the entire monsoon session amid huge protests by opposition members on inflation and other issues. The suspended MPs are Manickam Tagore, Ramya Haridas, Jothimani and TN Prathapan. Monday was the sixth day of the monsoon session of Parliament.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: PM 'Kisan Harassment' scheme: Rahul criticises Centre on farmer issues
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre on farmer issues. "PM 'Kisan Harassment' scheme...no compensation for martyred farmers...no data on farmers suicide...insurance companies getting profits of ₹40,000 crore in the name of crop insurance," Rahul tweeted. He added, "Government was supposed to double the farmers' income by 2022 but have doubled their 'sufferings'."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP govt working to make Indian Muslims 2nd-class citizens: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said that the BJP government is working towards making the Indian Muslims as "second-class citizens". "The data given by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs reveals that out of the 32.26 lakh loans meant for street vendors under the SVANidhi scheme, only 331 loans were disbursed to minorities," Owaisi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: UP ex-MLA's son arrested by STF for gang rape, cheating from Pune
text: The Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force arrested former UP MLA Vijay Mishra's son from Pune on charges of gang rape and cheating. The accused, Vishnu Mishra, had been absconding since August 2020 and had a bounty of ₹1 lakh on his head, police said. Notably, Vijay has been in jail since 2020 on charges of property grabbing and cheating.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Can't even handle his family, how would he handle me?: Rajbhar to Akhilesh
text: SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar, who recently broke alliance with Samajwadi Party (SP), criticised Akhilesh Yadav saying that he couldn't even handle his family members. "Alright, he says that I am wrong. But Shivpal is his uncle...He cannot even handle his own uncle, his sister-in-law, his own family, how would he handle me?" he told reporters.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Youth Cong leader in Gujarat arrested for throwing ink on posters of CM, PM
text: A Youth Congress leader in Gujarat's Bharuch district was arrested for allegedly throwing ink on the posters of CM Bhupendra Patel and PM Narendra Modi. The accused, Nikhil Shah, was protesting at the Bharuch Collector's office against the Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Sonia Gandhi. Shah had "secretly brought an ink pen" and was arrested under IPC's section 505, police said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Encourage use of bhang, cannabis as alternative to liquor to prevent crime: BJP MLA
text: Chhattisgarh BJP MLA Krishnamurti Bandhi suggested that use of bhang and cannabis should be encouraged as an alternative to liquor for addiction. He claimed that persons addicted to these substances hardly commit offences like rape, murder and dacoity. "Once I had discussed it in Assembly...Somewhere alcohol is the reason for rape, murder and quarrel...It's my personal opinion," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: People devoid of development for years can see me as their reflection: President Murmu
text: After taking oath as the 15th President of India, Droupadi Murmu on Monday said that her nomination has blessings of the poor behind it. "Satisfying to me that the people who were devoid of development for years, the poor, Dalits, backwards and the tribals, can see me as their reflection," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Members bringing placards won’t be allowed to take part in House proceedings: Birla
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said any member who brings a placard into the House will not be allowed to take part in the House proceedings. "The government is ready to hold a discussion," Birla added. "It is the responsibility of the members to maintain the dignity of the House," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Utterances of BJP leaders give rise to wrong impression: JD(U)'s Kushwaha
text: Amid rumours of a rift between the NDA allies, JD(U) and BJP, senior JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha has said that there are "no major issues" between the two parties. "But utterances of BJP leaders often give rise to a wrong impression. They [BJP] should refrain from making intemperate statements," Kushwaha, who is also an MLC from Bihar, said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Unlike earlier rebellions, this coup is to finish off Sena forever: Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said unlike earlier rebellions in the party, the revolt this time was aimed at “finishing off” the party. "Unlike the earlier rebellions, this coup is to finish off the Shiv Sena forever. They have hired professional agencies to counter us. This is a battle between money and loyalty," Thackeray added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kharge's seat didn’t commensurate with position at President’s oath ceremony: Oppn
text: After Droupadi Murmu took oath as the President of India on Monday, Opposition parties wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman stating that the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge was made to sit in a seat “not commensurate with the position he holds” at the event. “We’re writing to express our shock...at this deliberate disrespect shown,” the letter read.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Unjust step taken against Anganwadi workers by Delhi govt: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has criticised the Delhi government for sacking over 800 Anganwadi workers demanding increase in honorarium. "Delhi government has increased the legislators' salaries," Priyanka said. "But, taking an unjust step, the government sacked over 800 Anganwadi workers demanding a respectable honorarium. Asking for a good honorarium for hard work is not a crime," she added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP govt threatened since AAP formed govt in 2 states: AAP leader
text: AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj said since AAP has formed governments in two states, BJP has started feeling "threatened". His statement came after Delhi LG VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into alleged violation of Delhi Excise Policy. "Ever since Arvind Kejriwal has come up in form of PM Modi’s biggest challenge…BJP government…asked all agencies to persecute AAP ministers," Bharadwaj added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mamata didn't pick Partha's call, he's being left alone: West Bengal BJP MP
text: West Bengal Bharatiya Janata Party MP Saumitra Khan said that state minister Partha Chatterjee called state Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at the time of his arrest but Banerjee did not pick up his call. He reportedly added that Chatterjee did the scam on Banerjee's instructions but now was being "left alone".
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: ED takes Partha Chatterjee to AIIMS Bhubaneswar after Calcutta HC order
text: The Enforcement Directorate took West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee to AIIMS Bhubaneswar through air-ambulance on Monday. This came after Chatterjee complained of "uneasiness". Chatterjee was earlier sent to SSKM Hospital on local court's order. However, ED had approached the Calcutta High Court against the local court's order, after which, the High Court had ordered the shift to AIIMS.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: People of PoK look to India questioning when will they get freedom: RSS leader
text: RSS leader Dattatreya Hosabale said that the people of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir look towards India questioning when will they get freedom. "Since 1947, Pakistan has made every attempt to propagate terrorism, separatism and war in J&K," he added. "People of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir are the first victims. They should get complete justice. They are longing today," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Watershed moment for India: PM Modi as Droupadi Murmu takes oath as President
text: As Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that her assuming the Presidency is a watershed moment for India, especially for the poor, marginalised and downtrodden. "I wish her the very best for a fruitful Presidential tenure," PM Modi tweeted. She defeated Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Thursday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Maharashtra govt will fall due to its internal fights: Sanjay Raut
text: After Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of state, Shiv Sena’s Sanjay Raut said the Maharashtra government will fall due to its internal fights. "This dispensation will never stand on strong legs," Raut added. "This regime will not last," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tribal community set to make a new beginning: Arjun Munda on Prez Murmu
text: Soon after Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India, Union Minister Arjun Munda said that tribal community is set to make a new beginning, with a tribal woman holding the highest office of the land. "This constitutional position is above the party lines," he added. Notably, Murmu is the first tribal woman to take charge as President.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 5 days of monsoon session wasted, govt not ready for discussion: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said there has been no meaningful discussion in the House since the monsoon session of the Parliament commenced. "The government has not yet called the Opposition for talks, it is clear that the government is not ready for discussion in the House. Five days of monsoon session…have been wasted," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: SC asks Cong leader to approach HC over law linking Aadhaar & Voter ID
text: The Supreme Court on Monday directed Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala to approach the High Court over his petition challenging the Centre's June 19 notification linking Aadhaar and Voter ID cards. Surjewala stated in his petition that the law is unconstitutional and ultra vires the Constitution by violating citizens' Fundamental Right to Privacy and Right to Equality.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Opposition demanding discussion on price rise but Modi govt refuses: Jairam
text: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the BJP-led Centre for allegedly refusing to discuss inflation and GST on food items in the parliament. "Combined Opposition, including TMC and AAP, has been demanding an urgent discussion...But the Modi government remains adamant and has refused. Protests continue [on Monday]. Two adjournments already and this time till 4 pm," Jairam said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: J&K admin forcing people to participate in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti raised questions over the collection of money by the Jammu and Kashmir administration for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign alleging that traders and shop owners are forced to deposit money for tricolours. The manner in which people are being forced looks like Kashmir is an "enemy territory" that needs to be captured, she said in a tweet.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Delhi Police put up PM's posters at Delhi govt's event, CM Kejriwal to skip it: AAP
text: AAP alleged that Delhi Police forcibly put up banners carrying pictures of PM Narendra Modi at Delhi government's Van Mahotsav event. Environment Minister Gopal Rai said the Centre "hijacked" the event and turned it into a "political event" for PM Modi. Rai added that CM Arvind Kejriwal, who was scheduled to participate in the event on Sunday, will skip it.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Irani sends legal notice to Congress leaders for claiming her daughter ran 'illegal bar'
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday sent legal notices to the Congress party and three of its leaders over their allegations against her 18-year-old daughter Zoish. Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh and Netta D'Souza received notices from Irani who refuted claims that her daughter ran an "illegal bar" in Goa. She sought a written unconditional apology and withdrawal of allegations.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: K'taka Cong to observe 'Mauna Satyagraha' on Tue over ED questioning Sonia
text: Karnataka Congress will observe 'Mauna Satyagraha' (silent resistence) on Tuesday as party leader Sonia Gandhi appears before the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the National Herald case, state unit president DK Shivakumar said. Satyagraha will be organised for the entire duration of Gandhi's questioning. All MPs, MLAs, AICC office-bearers, councillors will take part in the Satyagraha.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Maha will have to face mid-term polls, govt will soon collapse: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday said that the Maharashtra government will soon collapse. "Mark my words...this government will soon collapse and Maharashtra will have to face mid-term polls," Aaditya added. "While working in the government, Uddhav Ji's only mistake was that he couldn't indulge in politicking. He did not snoop on his MLAs and MPs," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Introspection needed by media: Anurag Thakur after CJI's remark
text: After CJI NV Ramana said media is running "kangaroo courts", Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday called for introspection by media houses. "We need to introspect whether we have crossed the 'Lakshman Rekha' while delivering news," Thakur added. "I wish to urge friends in media that if such an impression is being created, there's a need for introspection," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Secure future of students who returned from Ukraine: TN CM tells PM
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has written to PM Narendra Modi, requesting Centre to secure the future of medical students who returned from Ukraine. "[Tamil Nadu] has been...urging you...to accommodate [them] in India or in...universities abroad," he wrote. Centre recently told Lok Sabha there's no permission from National Medical Commission to accommodate Ukraine-returned students in local colleges.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: People's mandate does not prevail in today's democratic system: Alva
text: The Opposition candidate for the Vice-Presidential polls, Margaret Alva has said that the "tragedy of today's democratic system is that the mandate of people does not prevail". "Muscle and money power and threats change the composition of the elected framework," Alva said. "How can a democracy function with the government slogan seemingly being 'my way or no way'," she asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray didn't give enough time to MLAs: Rebel Sena MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil alleged that party chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray did not give enough time to MLAs during his tenure as the CM. Patil said Thackeray should get rid of the coterie of party leaders around him. He added, "When Thackeray was just the party head, we could raise our complaints against a minister."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: People feel food, clothes must come at lower prices: RSS leader
text: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale has commented on the rising inflation in India. "The link between inflation and food prices needs to be pondered over...People feel food and clothes must come at lower prices. It...should be affordable," Hosabale said. "The farmer must benefit from doubling the farmer scheme. He does not always get a guaranteed income," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Govt believes scientific knowledge can be met by gazing at sky: Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised the BJP-led Centre for raising the GST on scientific equipment needed by research institutions and universities "from 5% to 12-18%". "The government perhaps believes that all the scientific knowledge that we need can be gathered by gazing at the sky and re-imagining our past," Chidambaram said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: This is harassment: DK Shivakumar on ED summon to Sonia Gandhi
text: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said ED has summoned party’s interim chief Sonia Gandhi which was "unnecessary". "After fifty hours of interrogation of Rahul Gandhi, the ED has now summoned Sonia Gandhi…This is harassment. We would be observing a peaceful protest on the 26th [July]," he added. ED has issued fresh summon to Sonia Gandhi for July 26, reports stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: TMC stands for 'The Mountain of Corruption': Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that TMC stands for "The Mountain of Corruption". His remark came after West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s arrest by the ED. "Mamata Banerjee is breaking all the records of corruption…Corruption is running rampant in her party and her government. Her ministers have a free hand to indulge in corruption," Thakur added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Send Rahul back to fight from Amethi in 2024 & he’ll lose again: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday reacted to the allegations of her daughter Zoish running an “illegal” bar in Goa. “To the Gandhi family, which directed that this press conference be held against my child, I tell you to send Rahul Gandhi back to fight the Lok Sabha election in 2024 from Amethi and he’ll lose again,” Irani said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nehru's intentions could be good but same doesn't apply to policies: Rajnath
text: During an event to pay homage to the martyrs of the 1999 Kargil War, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh commented on the 1962 India-China War when Jawaharlal Nehru was India's Prime Minister. "In 1962, China captured our area in Ladakh. I will not question  Nehru's intentions. It can be good but the same does not apply to policies," Rajnath said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Congress to hold 'Satyagraha' on day Sonia appears before ED
text: The Congress party has asked its state units to organise peaceful 'Satyagraha' on July 26, the day when its president Sonia Gandhi is due to appear before the ED for questioning in the National Herald case. The party has instructed all its MPs, party General Secretaries and CWC members to be present in the 'Satyagraha' to be observed in Delhi.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Everyone in Bengal knew about it: Adhir Ranjan on TMC minister's arrest
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has commented on TMC leader and West Bengal minister, Partha Chatterjee being arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "Everyone in Bengal knew about this (scam). After the court's intervention, investigation agencies started acting upon it. We want culprits to be punished," Chowdhury said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No judiciary in world is as independent as India’s: Rijiju
text: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said no judiciary in the world is as independent as India’s. His statement came after CJI NV Ramana's remark on media running "kangaroo courts". "Indian judges and judiciary are completely protected. I can say clearly that no judge or judiciary is as independent anywhere in the world as it is in India," Rijiju added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Youth’s future in danger with new experiment in PM’s laboratory: Rahul on Agnipath
text: Commenting on the Agnipath scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said youth's future is in danger. He tweeted, "60,000 soldiers retire every year, out of which only 3,000 are getting government jobs. What will be the future of thousands of Agniveers retiring after four-year contract? With this new experiment in PM’s laboratory, security of country and youth’s future are in danger."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: For what?: Cong leader's reply to Smriti Irani's notice amid 'illegal' bar row
text: Congress Spokesperson Shama Mohamed has demanded Union Minister Smriti Irani's apology "for allegedly manipulating licenses" in "illegal bar" row. This comes after Irani sent a legal notice to Congress and its three leaders for alleging her daughter ran an "illegal" bar in Goa. "For what? There's ample proof that her daughter was running the restaurant," Mohamed said regarding Irani's notice.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP Minority Morcha to hold Gurugram camp to discuss Lok Sabha polls
text: The Minority Morcha of the Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) is going to organise a three-day national training camp in Gurugram, Haryana. At the camp, the party will discuss the strategy for the general election with the aim to reach out to the minority community of the country. The three-day programme will be held from July 25 to July 27.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Eknath Shinde was made CM with heavy heart: Maharashtra BJP chief
text: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Saturday said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of the state. "The central leadership and Devendra Ji (Devendra Fadnavis) decided to back Eknath Shinde as CM with a heavy heart," Patil added. "We were unhappy but decided to accept the decision," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP replaced 'happiness classes' with 'glasses': BJP on Delhi's liquor policy
text: Speaking about Delhi government's liquor policy, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Sunday stated that the ruling AAP has replaced the 'happiness classes' model with 'happiness glasses'. "Kejriwal liquor model can be explained as 'ABCD' where A stands for advertising, B for bahane baazi and blame game, C for corruption and cover-up and D for deviation or diversion," Poonawalla stated.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: BJP top brass to decide if my son will contest from Shikaripura: BSY
text: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa (BSY) said that PM Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and JP Nadda will decide if his son would contest from the Shikaripura constituency. Earlier, Yediyurappa said that he wouldn't contest from the constituency and asked people to support his son BY Vijayendra. The decision of BJP leaders is final in this matter, BSY said.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Free to leave alliance: Samajwadi Party to Shivpal and OP Rajbhar
text: Samajwadi Party told MLA Shivpal Yadav and SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar that they are "free to leave" the alliance. The development comes after both Shivpal and Rajbhar supported rival NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. In its letter, SP claimed that Rajbhar is working for BJP and asked Shivpal to leave if he feels he will get more respect elsewhere.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: MVA collapse happened due to Uddhav, Fadnavis shouldn't take all credit: Raj
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that neither Amit Shah nor Devendra Fadnavis are responsible for the MVA government's collapse. "I told Fadnavis to not take much credit as all credit...goes to Uddhav Thackeray," he said in an interview. He added that though some people accuse Sanjay Raut and his statements for the collapse, even he is not responsible for it.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Where does WB govt want to take youth of state?: Pradhan on Partha's arrest
text: Following the arrest of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan asked, "Where does the state government want to take the youth of Bengal?" Furthermore, he said, "₹21 crore cash was found at his residence. He is arrested and he is a minister, this shows the condition of Bengal today. This is a serious matter."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Can't sit back & say we don't have numbers: Oppn VP candidate Alva
text: Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva has said that while there's disunity among non-BJP parties over her nomination, she doesn't feel perturbed as the final tally of votes can always swing. "We can't just sit back and say we don't have the numbers, so we won't fight...election," she added. TMC has decided to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Will act after verdict is out: TMC as ED arrests Bengal minister Partha
text: Following West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in an alleged teacher recruitment scam, TMC leader Firhad Hakim said the party will act "after the judiciary comes out with its verdict". "We're watching the situation and have faith in the judiciary. TMC will not tolerate any discrepancy or malpractice in party or in government," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: ED seizes ₹20 crore-cash after raids on Bengal minister Partha's aide, others
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹20 crore after raiding various premises, including the house of Arpita Mukherjee, an associate of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam, ED stated.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee hospitalised hours after arrest
text: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a teacher recruitment scam, was admitted to the Intensive Coronary Care Unit (ICCU) of SSKM Hospital after he complained of uneasiness, an official of ED said. According to a hospital official, several tests, including electrocardiogram, were conducted. "He is stable at the moment," the official added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Irani denies 'illegal' Goa bar is run by daughter, says 'she's a college student'
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday denied claims that her 18-year-old daughter Zoish was running a restaurant with an alleged illegal bar license. Irani said her daughter is leading life as an "ordinary college student", adding, "Her only fault is that her mother fought elections against Rahul Gandhi from Amethi." She said her daughter's "character was assassinated by Congressmen".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: West Bengal minister Partha arrested by ED after ₹20 crore cash found at aide's home
text: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The ED on Friday recovered ₹20 crore in cash from the house of an aide of Chatterjee. "The said amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam," the probe agency had said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: MPs should always follow Gandhian philosophy: Prez in farewell speech
text: During his farewell address on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "MPs should always follow the Gandhian philosophy while exercising rights of debate and dissent in Parliament." "Mahatma Gandhi used peace and non-violence to instil harmony...we must adopt his ways," he added. The President further urged political parties to "rise above partisan politics" in national interest.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Parliament is a temple of democracy: Outgoing President Kovind
text: President Ram Nath Kovind, in his farewell address to parliamentarians, termed Parliament a "temple of democracy". "As in any family, sometimes there are differences of opinion even in Parliament," he said. "But we're all members of the 'Parliament family' whose top priority is to continue working in the interest of the big joint family of the nation," President Kovind added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Submit documents to prove majority in Shiv Sena: ECI to Shinde, Thackeray
text: The Election Commission of India has asked Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde to submit documentary evidence to prove their majority numbers in Shiv Sena. Thackeray and Shinde have been directed to submit written statements by 1 pm on August 8. "Both the groups claim to be the real Shiv Sena with their leader being the alleged Sena president," ECI stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: During pandemic, India's efforts were praised globally: Outgoing Prez
text: In his farewell speech in the Parliament on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "World is struggling because of...pandemic. I hope we learn lessons from the pandemic, we forgot that we're all part of nature." "In difficult times, India's efforts were praised all across the world," he added. PM Narendra Modi and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu attended the ceremony.
author: Shailesh

headlines: See you in court of law & court of people: Irani to Congress over allegations on daughter
text: Hitting out at Congress for allegations against her daughter Zoish, Smriti Irani said, "Her character was publicly mutilated by Congress spokespeople." She called the allegations against Zoish "malicious" and said, "I'll see you (Congress leaders) in the court of law and in the court of people." Congress earlier held a press conference alleging Zoish's restaurant had an illegal bar license.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Model Arpita, aide of WB minister Partha, arrested after ₹20cr found at her home
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday arrested model and actress Arpita Mukherjee, a close aide of arrested West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. This came a day after the agency said it found ₹20 crore from her residence during raids in connection to the state's School Service Commission (SSC) teacher recruitment scam. Chatterjee was sent to two days of ED custody.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: SP's Azam Khan urges UP govt to provide him 'Z' category security
text: SP leader Azam Khan, who was recently released from Sitapur jail, urged the UP government to reinstate his 'Z' category security, contending that he and his family faced "many threats". "Right now I have 'Y' category security which is of no relevance," he said. In 2017, Yogi Adityanath's government had downgraded the security cover of over 100 politicians including Khan.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: People haven't lost faith in MVA, they're disgusted by dirty politics: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray has said that the people haven't lost faith in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA), rather they're "disgusted with the dirty politics of greed" displayed by the rebel party leaders. He also blamed the "greed of traitors" for the split in the party, adding, "The other blame may be is on us, for trusting too much."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: TMC has emerged as party of thieves under Mamata's leadership: BJP MP
text: BJP MP and Vice President of party's West Bengal unit Saumitra Khan on Saturday criticised CM Mamata Banerjee over the arrest of minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. "Tomorrow Firhad Hakim will be arrested, then Abhishek Banerjee," Khan stated. "TMC has emerged as...party of thieves and scamsters under the leadership of Mamata Banerjee," he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: NDA stands for 'No Data Available': Rahul criticises govt over lack of data
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led NDA government for allegedly not having data on various points. "No Data Available [NDA] government wants you to believe [that]...no one died of oxygen shortage...no farmer died protesting...no migrant died walking...no one was mob lynched...no journalist has been arrested," Rahul tweeted. He also shared a GIF, which said, "Sab Gayab Si."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will Sisodia too lose memory?: Anurag amid row over Delhi Excise Policy
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of shielding the "corrupt" after LG VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Delhi Excise Policy. "There were allegations against Satyendar Jain who lost his memory in jail. Will Manish Sisodia too lose memory?" Thakur stated. "AAP government has set new records of corruption," he further said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Maha CM lifts restrictions on festivals imposed due to COVID-19
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has lifted restrictions on festivals which were in force since March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Now, there will be no curbs on Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram processions, among other religious events. The earlier restrictions included ban on processions and curbs on the height of Lord Ganesh idols.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: Chhattisgarh to start process to recruit 10,000 school teachers: CM Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that the state government will soon start the process of recruiting "10,000 new teachers" for its schools. "Since 1998, the state government has recruited 14,000 teachers so far," CM Baghel said. He also added that 163 mobile veterinary units would be rolled out soon for the treatment of animals in the state.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Kejriwal to visit HP to administer oath to over 5,000 AAP workers
text: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal will visit Himachal Pradesh on Monday to administer oath to more than 5,000 officer bearers of AAP in Solan, ANI reported. Kejriwal will be accompanied by Punjab CM and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann. This comes ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Earlier, AAP organised a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Palampur.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: PFI is like RSS, why do you call them anti-nationals?: RJD leader
text: In an interview with ANI, Bihar's RJD chief Jagadanand Singh said Islamic terrorist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) is like Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). He added, "They (PFI) also want to serve their community...Why do you call them anti-nationals?" He alleged, "Whenever...security forces [arrested people] as Pakistani agents, all of them were related to RSS and Hindu community."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: People's money being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal: Scindia
text: After West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by Enforcement Directorate (ED), Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said his arrest is evidence of the fact that how people's money is being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal. "People will get to completely know about it, I'm confident," Scindia said. Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: I'm vacating Shikaripura seat, son Vijayendra will contest: Yediyurappa
text: Former Karnataka CM and BJP leader BS Yediyurappa said on Friday that he will be vacating his Shikaripura constituency seat and won't contest the next Assembly election. He added that his son Vijayendra will contest from the constituency. He also urged people to make sure that Vijayendra wins with a margin "bigger" than his own.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Cross-voting in Bihar shows resentment in Oppn: BJP MP on Prez polls
text: Bihar BJP President and Lok Sabha MP Dr Sanjay Jaiswal said that there is evidence of cross-voting on a "substantial scale" during the Presidential elections in the state. He added that NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu received 133 votes from the state, while their "effective strength...was 125". He claimed that this shows resentment in the Opposition against their leader.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Sack Smriti Irani: Congress' Pawan Khera amid 'illegal' bar row
text: At a press meet on Saturday, Congress leader Pawan Khera said, "We demand from the Prime Minister that Smriti Irani should be immediately sacked as a [Union Minister]...You owe it to this country." This comes amid allegations of Irani's daughter Zoish running an "illegal" bar in Goa. "Was the illegal act carried out without [Smriti's] knowledge or influence?" Khera asked.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: AAP to contest all wards in B'luru civic polls, invites candidates
text: Aam Aadmi Party Karnataka chief Prithvi Reddy on Friday said that the party will contest polls in all wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). "As a part of the 'One Chance to Kejriwal' campaign, a Candidate Search Committee has been formed," Reddy said. We invite people from different walks of life to fight elections, he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP won more seats under Yediyurappa: Shivakumar after ex-CM vacates seat
text: After ex-Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announced his decision to vacate the Shikaripura assembly seat for his son BY Vijayendra, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the BJP leader should not announce retirement as he "still has political strength". "The BJP has won more seats under his leadership but not with the name of another person," Shivakumar added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Delhi CM skips weekly meeting called by LG amid tensions: Report
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal skipped the weekly meeting called by Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Friday, ANI reported. This comes after the LG refused to give permission to Kejriwal to travel to Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. Notably, Saxena has also recommended a CBI probe into the alleged violations of the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: AAP's time has come, not scared of jails: Kejriwal on CBI probe recommendation
text: After L-G VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22, the Delhi Chief Minister said that AAP's time has come. "We are not scared of jails, not scared of the noose. They have made several cases against our people. The AAP has been growing since its win in Punjab...nothing will stop us," Kejriwal added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Not the time for ego: Oppn VP candidate on TMC's decision to skip polls
text: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva on Friday called TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections "disappointing". "This isn't the time for 'whataboutery', ego or anger," she said. "This is the time for courage, leadership and unity. I believe Mamata Banerjee, who is the epitome of courage, will stand with the Opposition," Alva added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Historic moment as Prez's post will be held by tribal woman: Meghalaya CM
text: After Droupadi Murmu was elected as the President of India, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said, "It's a great and historic moment as the President's post will now be held by a tribal woman." "It's something that was inconceivable many years ago. I'd like to thank all who voted for our President, PM and others...who made this possible," he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Video shows Ajoy asking to be 'detained' after Cong protests, he replies
text: A video of Congress leader Ajoy Kumar asking to be taken inside the police bus which was carrying detained Congress leaders after Thursday's protests has gone viral. The video showed Kumar saying, "You need to take me yaar...Humko bhi ghusne do." He later tweeted, "The bus was full...Had it been a demonstration of the RSS-BJP, the bus would've remained empty."
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Oppn unity is bit of chimera: Omar on TMC abstaining from VP poll voting
